subtermitto: <entryFree id="n46145" type="main" key="subtermitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subter-mitto</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to place underneath</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Quaest. in Heptat. 2:177:14" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Quaest. in Heptat. 2, 177, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subtermoveo: <entryFree id="n46146" type="main" key="subtermo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subter-mŏvĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to push under</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 16, 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subternatans: <entryFree id="n46147" type="hapax" key="subterna^tans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subter-nătans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [nato], <sense id="n46147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">swimming under</hi> any thing, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 32, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subternus: <entryFree id="n46148" type="main" key="subternus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subternus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>subter</etym>, <sense id="n46148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is underneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lower</hi>, = infernus (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">antra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 1, 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hamart. 930</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subtero: <entryFree id="n46149" type="main" key="subte^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-tĕro</orth>, <itype>trīvi, trītum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rub off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wear away underneath; to rub</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bruise</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">grind to pieces</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): boves ne pedes subterant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 72</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:15:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 16, 62, § 221</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumenta cito subteruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 51:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 51, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salis sextarium subterito, et subtritum, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>pound</tr>, <tr>triturate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:5:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caepam aridam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:5:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 5, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:25" default="NO">2, 10, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 20, 82, § 218</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:80" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 9, 23, § 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subterpendens: <entryFree id="n46150" type="hapax" key="subterpendens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subter-pendens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [pendeo], <sense id="n46150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hanging down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subterraneus: <entryFree id="n46151" type="main" key="subterra_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-terrānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>terra</etym>, <sense id="n46151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">underground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subterranean</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">specus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 26, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">supterraneos specus aperire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergastulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">structura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 50, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:149" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Sept. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:16:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subterraneis venis in mare defluunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 20, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 13, 19, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 11, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subterraneis dolis peractum urbis excidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 12</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-terrānĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a subterranean place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipso subterraneo semirotundo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 260, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subterrenus: <entryFree id="n46152" type="hapax" key="subterre_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-terrēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">underground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subterrene</hi>, = subterraneus: <cit><quote lang="la">plagae orbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 227, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subterreus: <entryFree id="n46153" type="hapax" key="subterre^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-terrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">underground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subterranean</hi>, = subterraneus: <cit><quote lang="la">divi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 226</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subterseco: <entryFree id="n46154" type="hapax" key="subterse^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subter-sĕco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate underneath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medium Capricornum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=273" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 273</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subtersterno: <entryFree id="n46155" type="main" key="subtersterno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subter-sterno</orth>, <itype>strāvi, strātum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spread under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strew under</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëra jaculis et sagittis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 2:17" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 2, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subtertenuo: <entryFree id="n46156" type="hapax" key="subterte^nu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subter-tĕnŭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make</hi> <cb n="SUBT" /> <hi rend="ital">thin below</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at the lower part</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 312</bibl></cit> (Lachm. subter tenuatur).</sense></entryFree>
subtertius: <entryFree id="n46157" type="hapax" key="subterti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-tertĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, of a number, <sense id="n46157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">less by a third of itself</hi> (i. e. that bears to another the ratio of 3 to 4), a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(po/tritos</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 761</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subtervacans: <entryFree id="n46158" type="hapax" key="subterva^cans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subter-văcans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [vaco], <sense id="n46158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">empty below;</hi> locus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:25:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 25, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subtervolo: <entryFree id="n46159" type="hapax" key="subtervo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subter-vŏlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fly beneath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fragor subtervolat astra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:669" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 669</bibl></cit> (al. subter volat).</sense></entryFree>
subtexo: <entryFree id="n46160" type="main" key="subtexo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-texo</orth>, <itype>xŭi, xtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to weave under</hi> or <hi rend="ital">below</hi> any thing; hence, <hi rend="ital">to join on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affix</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n46160.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">lunam alutae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:192" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 192</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrio capiti nubes, i. e. soli,</quote> <trans><tr>to draw before</tr>, <tr>veil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 368</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nox subtexta polo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol diem subtexit Olympo,</quote> <trans><tr>spreads around Olympus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:414" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 414</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">To cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">darken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obscure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal</hi>, with <case>acc.</case> of thing concealed: <cit><quote lang="la">subtexunt nubila caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:466" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 466</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caerula nimbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 482</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum fumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 582</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem atrā nube,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 422" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 422</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aethera ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 519</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n46160.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46160.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To add</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">append</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subjoin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 18, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtexit fabulae huic, legatos interrogatos esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ab re fuerit subtexere, quae ... evenerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam officiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46160.4" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to put together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrive</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:211" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">originem familiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impedimenta Romanis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 20</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n46160.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To mix</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtexta malis bona sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 3, 526</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subtextus: <entryFree id="n46161" type="main" key="subtextus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subtextus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of subtexo.</entryFree>
subtililoquentia: <entryFree id="n46162" type="hapax" key="subti_li^lo^quenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subtīlĭlŏquentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subtililoquus</etym>, <sense id="n46162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">elegant language</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 19 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
subtililoquus: <entryFree id="n46163" type="hapax" key="subti_li^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subtīlĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>subtilisloquor</etym>, <sense id="n46163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speaking finely</hi> or <hi rend="ital">elegantly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 19 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
subtilis: <entryFree id="n46164" type="main" key="subti_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subtīlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sub-tela; and therefore, prop., woven fine; hence</etym>, <sense id="n46164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not thick</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coarse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">minute</hi> (syn. tenuis). </sense><sense id="n46164.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): quae vulgo volitant subtili praedita filo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus subtili corpore tenuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:901" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 901</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:54:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 54, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies gladii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">farina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 14, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtilia et minuta primordia rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:114" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 114</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">subtīlĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">fine goods</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stuffs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 19, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">indui te subtilibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ezech. 16, 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">harundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen raporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 13, 34, § 129</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus subtilissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 5, 4, § 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46164.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the senses, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exqui site</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">palatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtilior gula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46164.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exact</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accurate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subtle</hi> (class.; syn.: elegans, concinnus). </sense><sense id="n46164.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">sollers subtilisque descriptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">definitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:23:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 23, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">observatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 13, 35, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 17, 46, § 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 108, 112, § 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 16, 16, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 718</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquae (epistulae) subtiliores erunt,</quote> <trans><tr>more particular</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 14, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (curatio manus) inter subtilissimas haberi potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inventum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 23, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Democritus, subtilissimus antiquorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 7:3:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 7, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46164.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of taste or judgment, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exquisite</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">sagax, acutus): judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 242</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">subtilis veterum judex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 7, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapiens subtilisque lector,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir subtilis, dispositus, acer, disertus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 17</bibl></cit>; 4, 17, 4.—</sense><sense id="n46164.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in rhet., of speech or of the speaker, <hi rend="ital">plain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simple</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unadorned</hi> (syn. simplex): <cit><quote lang="la">genus dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:21:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 21, 69</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">acutissimum et subtilissimum dicendi genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:5:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 5, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoicorum non ignoras, quam sit subtile vel spinosum potius dicendi genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: subtile quod <foreign lang="greek">i)sxno\n</foreign> vocant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis illo (Catone) in docendo edisserendoque subtilior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:17:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 17, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratione limatus atque subtilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 180</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 8, 31</bibl>: Lysias subtilis scriptor atque <pb n="1785" /> <cb n="SUBT" /> elegans, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 9, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceptor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:51" default="NO">12, 10, 51</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">subtīlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">finely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">minutely.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46164.7" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtiliter insinuatus ad parvas partes aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1031" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1031</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conexae res,</quote> <trans><tr>closely</tr>, <tr>intimately</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:739" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 739</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dividere aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 12, 13, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fodere,</quote> <trans><tr>lightly</tr>, <tr>superficially</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n46164.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">finely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acutely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">minutely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accurately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subtly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46164.9" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">subtiliter judicare,</quote> <trans><tr>finely</tr>, <tr>acutely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:57:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 57, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de re publicā quid ego tibi subtiliter? tota periit,</quote> <trans><tr>minutely</tr>, <tr>particularly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 21, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ad te scribam alias subtilius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtiliter exsequi numerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de aliquā re subtiliter disserere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid persequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 98</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">id persequar subtilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:23:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 23, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtilius haec disserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtilius ista quaerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7</bibl></cit> et saep. — </sense><sense id="n46164.10" n="b" level="4"> In partic., in rhet., <hi rend="ital">plainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without ornament</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humilia subtiliter et magna graviter et mediocria temperate dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:29:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 29, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versute et subtiliter dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privatas causas agere subtilius: capitis aut famae ornatius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnifice an subtiliter dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subtilitas: <entryFree id="n46165" type="main" key="subti_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subtīlĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">supt-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subtilis</etym>, <sense id="n46165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fineness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thinness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slenderness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">minuteness</hi> (syn. tenuitas). </sense><sense id="n46165.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): linearum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferramentorum,</quote> <trans><tr>the keen edge</tr>, <tr>sharpness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 9, 41, § 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inenarrabilis florum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immensa animalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11</bibl></cit>, prooem. 1, § <cit><quote lang="la">1: caelandi fingendique ac tingendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: umoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 65, 65, § 163</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46165.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46165.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">keenness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acuteness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">penetration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">definiteness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exactness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subtlety</hi>, etc. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: acumen, sollertia): sententiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:23:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 23, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea subtilitas, quam Atticam appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:17:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 17, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtilitas sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credunt plerique militaribus ingeniis subtilitatem deesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 113:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 113, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aristoteles, vir immensae subtilitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 34, 77, § 335</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 108, 112, § 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geometrica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 65, 65, § 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perversa grammaticorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 3, 4, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtilitas parcimoniae compendia invenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">picturae summa suptilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 9, 36, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inutilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 65:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 65, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam inutilia et inefficacia ipsa subtilitas reddit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 82:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 82, 24</bibl></cit>: nimia, id. ib 88, 43.—</sense><sense id="n46165.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in rhet., <hi rend="ital">plainness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simplicity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">absence of ornament</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis subtilitas imitabilis quidem illa videtur esse existimanti, sed nihil est experienti minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 23, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:84:291" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 84, 291</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavitatem Isocrates, subtilitatem Lysias, vim Demosthenes habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtilitas et elegantia scriptorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subtiliter: <entryFree id="n46166" type="main" key="subti_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subtīlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. subtilis <sense id="n46166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
subtimeo: <entryFree id="n46167" type="hapax" key="subti^me^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-tĭmĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be somewhat afraid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fear a little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquid subtimes, ne? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 14, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subtinnio: <entryFree id="n46168" type="hapax" key="subtinni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-tinnĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sound a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tinkle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
subtitubo: <entryFree id="n46169" type="main" key="subti^tu^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-tĭtŭbo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stagger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">totter</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">waver a little</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n46169.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: pede subtitubo, Ven. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:475" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 475</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n46169.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtitubante fide,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 651</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subtractio: <entryFree id="n46170" type="main" key="subtracti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subtractĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subtraho</etym>, <sense id="n46170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawing back</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ep. ad Hebr. 10, 39</bibl> (transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(postolh/</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
subtractus: <entryFree id="n46171" type="main" key="subtractus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subtractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of subtraho.</entryFree>
subtraho: <entryFree id="n46172" type="main" key="subtra^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-trăho</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to draw away from underneath</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by stealth;</hi> also, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to draw off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">withdraw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, etc. (class.; syn. subduco). </sense><sense id="n46172.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtractus Numida mortuo superincubanti Romano vivus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:51:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 51, 9</bibl></cit> (Weissenb. substratus): <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus raptim tellus subtracta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 605</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effracto colla jugo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:40" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viro (peculium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(impedimenta) clandestinā fugā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:33" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aggerem cuniculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si dediticii subtrahantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:37:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 37, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastatos primae legionis ex acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites ab dextro cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 37</bibl></cit>: cibum alicui, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 105, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam, quae laedere videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn away</tr>, <tr>avert</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se a curiā et ab omni parte rei publicae,</quote> <trans><tr>to withdraw</tr>, <tr>retire</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 16</bibl></cit>: <cb n="SUBU" /> teque adspectu ne subtrahe nostro, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 465</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Armeniam ad Parthos se subtrahentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:43" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus domino se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 17</bibl></cit>. — Also without <hi rend="ital">se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">repente interdiu vel noctu subtrahebat,</quote> <trans><tr>he would withdraw</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectum praetorio non ex ingerentibus sed ex subtrahentibus legere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:86:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 86, 2</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Mid.: vastis tremit ictibus puppis Subtrahiturque solum,</quote> <trans><tr>withdraws itself</tr>, <tr>gives way under it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtracto solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtractus fugā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 37, 56, § 134</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46172.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque verba sedem habere possunt, si rem subtraxeris, neque, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necessaria cum periculo subtrahuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba pudoris gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">S litteram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">narrationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina candidatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 81</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: aliis nominatis, me unum subtrahebat,</quote> <trans><tr>to omit</tr>, <tr>not mention</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:10:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 10, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">9: aliquem bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cui judicio eum mors subtraxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem irae militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem minis populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:4:20" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 4, 20</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Reflex.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me a curiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se legum actionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se oneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se labori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:9:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se discrimini alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:86" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 86 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Ruhnk. et saep.: subtrahente se, <hi rend="ital">withdrawing himself</hi> (as surety), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subtremulus: <entryFree id="n46173" type="main" key="subtre^mu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-trĕmŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat tremulous</hi>, Ps.-Soran. 280.</sense></entryFree>
subtriplus: <entryFree id="n46174" type="main" key="subtriplus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-triplus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contained three times in</hi> a larger number, Boëth. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> Arith. 1, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subtristis: <entryFree id="n46175" type="main" key="subtristis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-tristis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat sad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sorrowful</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">subtristis visus est mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 107, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cera subtristior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 60, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subtritus: <entryFree id="n46176" type="main" key="subtri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subtrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of subtero.</entryFree>
subtunicalis: <entryFree id="n46177" type="main" key="subtu^ni^ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subtŭnĭcālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sub-tunica</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">u(podu/ths,</foreign> <sense id="n46177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the under-garment of a Jewish priest</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 29, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subturpiculus: <entryFree id="n46178" type="hapax" key="subturpi^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-turpĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat mean</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disgraceful</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subturpis: <entryFree id="n46179" type="hapax" key="subturpis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-turpis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat mean</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disgraceful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sint, quod ridiculi proprium est, subturpia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 264</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subtus: <entryFree id="n46180" type="main" key="subtus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>from sub; like intus, from in</etym>, <sense id="n46180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">underneath</hi> (mostly ante-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.): subtus ambulare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 48, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labra subtus pendula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani aggere et vineis et omnibus supra terram operibus, subtus Macedones cuniculis oppugnabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=131" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 131</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
subtussio: <entryFree id="n46181" type="hapax" key="subtussi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-tussĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cough slightly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 25</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
subtusus: <entryFree id="n46182" type="main" key="subtu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-tūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [tundo], <sense id="n46182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat bruised</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flet teneras subtusa genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:55" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 55</bibl></cit>: angulus, <hi rend="ital">an obtuse angle</hi>, Boëth. Geom. 1, p. 1180.</sense></entryFree>
subtutus: <entryFree id="n46183" type="main" key="subtu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-tūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moderately safe</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> Instr. 30, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subucula: <entryFree id="n46184" type="main" key="su^bu_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbūcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sub - UO; whence exuo</etym>. <sense id="n46184.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A man</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s under-garment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a shirt</hi>: postea quam binas tunicas habere coeperunt, instituerunt vocare subuculam et indusium, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 542, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 5, § 131</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 82</bibl>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Of the priest's dress,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 8, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n46184.1" n="II" level="1"> Subuculam Aelius Stilo et Cloatius iisdem fere verbis demonstrant vocari, quod dis detur ex alicā et oleo et melle. Nam de tunicae genere notum est omnibus, Fest. pp. 308 and 309 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
subula: <entryFree id="n46185" type="main" key="su_bu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūbŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n46185.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an awl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:16:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 16, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aënea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:5:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 14, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perforabit aurem ejus subulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 21, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deut. 15, 17</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n46185.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a very small weapon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subulā armatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">prov.: subulā leonem excipis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 82:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 82, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subulcus: <entryFree id="n46186" type="main" key="su^bulcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbulcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>from sus; formed in analogy with bubulcus</etym>, <sense id="n46186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swine-herd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 14</bibl> and 20; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:98:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 98, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 19</bibl> Wagn. (al. bubulci).</sense></entryFree>
subulo: <entryFree id="n46187" type="main" key="su_bu^lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūbŭlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n46187.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A flute-player</hi>, the Tuscan name for tibicen: <cit><quote lang="la">subulo Tusce tibicen dicitur. Itaque Ennius: Subulo quondam marinas propter astabat plagas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=309" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 309</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=35" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 35</bibl> ib. (Sat. v. 41 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n46187.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of hart</hi> <cb n="SUBV" /> <hi rend="ital">with pointed horns</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 213</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:231" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 17, 67, § 231</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n46187.2" n="III" level="1"> Perh. i. q. paedico, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46188" type="main" key="Su_bu^lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sūbŭlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. subulo</etym>, <sense id="n46188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname;</hi> e. g. P. Decius Subulo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subumbilicus: <entryFree id="n46189" type="main" key="su^bumbi^li_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-umbĭlīcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n46189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the parts below the navel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Zach. 1</bibl> ad 2, 18.</sense></entryFree>
subumidus: <entryFree id="n46190" type="hapax" key="su^bu_mi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ūmĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat moist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 6, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subunctio: <entryFree id="n46191" type="main" key="su^buncti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-unctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n46191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rubbing in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">faucium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:3:22" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 3, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subur: <entryFree id="n46192" type="main" key="Su^bur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭbur</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n46192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Spain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the river Rubricatus</hi>, perh. the mod. Villa Nuova, in Castile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 21</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭbūrĭtāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Subur</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 414, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subura: <entryFree id="n46193" type="main" key="Su^bu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭbūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (abbrev. SVG.; <sense id="n46193.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a quarter in Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the second region</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Esquiline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Viminal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Quirinal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where provisions were sold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and where many prostitutes dwelt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Subura Junius scribit ab eo, quod fuerit sub antiquā Urbe: quoi testimonium potest esse, quod subest ei loco, qui Terreus murus vocatur. Sed ego a pago potius Succusano dictam puto Succusam, quod in notā etiam nunc scribitur tertia littera C, non B,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=48" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 48</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Subura cum tribus litteris notatur, C litteram ostendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=309" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 309</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:66:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 66, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:31:12" default="NO">7, 31, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:94:5" default="NO">10, 94, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:18:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 18, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:32" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:141" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 141</bibl> (v. Subura, Becker, Antiq. vol. 1, p. 521 sq.; and cf. id. Gall. vol. 3, p. 44, 2d ed.). — Hence, </sense><sense id="n46193.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭbūrā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Subura</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Suburan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=46" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 46</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, § 56 ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:29:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 29, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=302" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 302</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">clivus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Esquiline</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:22:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 22, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:58" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a prostitute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:78:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 78, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:61:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 61, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46193.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭbūrānenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the dwellers in the Subura</hi>, Fest. s. v. October, p. 178 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
suburbanitas: <entryFree id="n46194" type="main" key="su^burba_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭburbānĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suburbanus</etym>, <sense id="n46194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nearness to the city of Rome</hi>: suburbanitas hujusce provinciae (Siciliae), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:3:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 3, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 2:22" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
suburbanus: <entryFree id="n46195" type="main" key="su^burba_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-urbānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">situated near the city of Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suburban.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46195.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus suburbanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:32:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 32, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gymnasium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio Italiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:61" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Italia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 4, 9, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrinatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 43</bibl></cit> et saep. — </sense><sense id="n46195.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46195.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭburbā-num</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. praedium), <hi rend="ital">an estate near Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a suburban villa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malo esse in Tusculano aut uspiam in suburbano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:13:6:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 13, 6, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suburbana amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:20:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 20, § 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 10, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:7:section=23 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 7, § 23 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 34, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 13</bibl>, b, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:42" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 3, 25, § 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:35:3 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 35, 3 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:25:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 25, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46195.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭburbāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the towns near Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:58" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suburbicarius: <entryFree id="n46196" type="main" key="su^burbi^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-urbĭcārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, late jurid. Lat. for suburbanus, <sense id="n46196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">situated near Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suburban</hi>: regiones, Cod. Th. 11, 1, 9; 11, 28, 12; 11, 16, 12: mare, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:94" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suburbium: <entryFree id="n46197" type="hapax" key="suburbi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-urbĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>urbs</etym>, <sense id="n46197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a suburb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suburbium ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 10, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suburgeo: <entryFree id="n46198" type="hapax" key="su^burge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-urgĕo</orth> (also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbur-guĕo</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">urge close to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proram ad saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 202</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suburitani: <entryFree id="n46199" type="main" key="Su^bu_ri^ta_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭbūrĭtāni</orth>, v. Subur.</entryFree>
suburo: <entryFree id="n46200" type="main" key="su^bu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭb-ūro</orth>, no <sense id="n46200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ustum</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to burn slightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to singe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scorch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura nuce ardenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subustum corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 7, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subustio: <entryFree id="n46201" type="hapax" key="su^busti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbustĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suburo</etym>, <sense id="n46201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a heating from below</hi>: thermarum, Cod. Th. 15, 1, 32.</sense></entryFree>
subustus: <entryFree id="n46202" type="main" key="su^bustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭbustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> from suburo.</entryFree>
subvades: <entryFree id="n46203" type="gloss" key="subva^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subvădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sub-vas</etym>, <sense id="n46203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sub-sureties</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">those who give surety for the bail</hi>, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:10:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 10, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subvectio: <entryFree id="n46204" type="main" key="subvecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subvectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subveho</etym>, <sense id="n46204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transporting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conveying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conveyance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">durae subvectiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subvecto: <entryFree id="n46205" type="main" key="subvecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subvecto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring up</hi> from below (on the shoulder, <pb n="1786" /> <cb n="SUBV" /> by ship, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">transport</hi> to a place (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">asini, qui tibi subvectabant rure huc virgas ulmeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa umeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:21" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, praef. 3: <cit><quote lang="la">panaria candidasque mappas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:32" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora cymbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves, quae frumentum Tiberi subvectassent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subvector: <entryFree id="n46206" type="hapax" key="subvector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subvector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>subveho</etym>, <sense id="n46206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carrier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conveyer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bosporus Inachiae subvector virginis olim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 199</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subvectus: <entryFree id="n46207" type="main" key="subvectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subvectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of subveho.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46208" type="main" key="subvectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subvectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>subveho</etym>, <sense id="n46208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a carrying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conveying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conveyance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 5, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subveho: <entryFree id="n46209" type="main" key="subve^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vĕho</orth>, <itype>vexi, vectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring up</hi> from below (on the shoulder, by ship, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">convey</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi> to a place, <hi rend="ital">to bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carry up stream</hi>, etc. (not freq. till after the Aug. per.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): ast alium (aërem fluere) subter, contra qui subvehat orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 515</bibl></cit>: frumentum flumine Arari navibus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversum remis superes subvectus ut amnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subvecta ponto Barbara agmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matris fratrisque cineres Romam Tiberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utensilia ad Ostia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germanicus Nilo subvehebatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philippus lembis biremibus flumine adverso subvectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:106:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 106, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 12, 43, § 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae, per quas commeatus ex Samnio subvehebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">commeatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 23, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 16, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Palladis arces Subvehitur magnā matrum regina catervā,</quote> <trans><tr>is borne aloft</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:478" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 478</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subvecta per aëra curru,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:796" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 796</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subvello: <entryFree id="n46210" type="main" key="subvello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vello</orth>, no <sense id="n46210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, vulsum (volsum), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to pluck up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pull out</hi> (only in the two foll. passages): rador, subvellor, desquamor, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 95, 15</bibl>: qui barba volsa feminibusque subvolsis ambulet, Scip. Afric. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:12:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 12, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subvelo: <entryFree id="n46211" type="main" key="subve_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vēlo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to overshadow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Lib. Arb. 2:38" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Lib. Arb. 2, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subvenio: <entryFree id="n46212" type="main" key="subve^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vĕnĭo</orth>, <itype>vēni, ventum, 4</itype> (old <sense id="n46212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> subvenibo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 20</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to come up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">advance to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s assistance</hi> (the figure taken from the advance of a military reserve; v. subsidium), <hi rend="ital">to come to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s assistance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relieve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succor; to obviate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cure</hi> a disease, an evil, etc. (freq. and class.; syn.: adjuvo, succurro, sublevo). </sense><sense id="n46212.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (equitibus) celeriter subveniunt levis armaturae pedites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:19" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucanius circumvento filio subvenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Varenus illi laboranti subvenit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo quaeso, subveni mihi atque adjuva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subveni patriae, opitulare collegae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subvenire et opitulari patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:154" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 43, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subvenisti homini jam perdito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:17:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 17, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauci subveniendum Adherbali censebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestri auxilii est, judices, hujus innocentiae subvenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saluti suae acrioribus remediis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabilitati dentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 3, 37, § 74</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">gravedini omni ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 61, § 129</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:112" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 9, 37, § 112</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic meae sollicitudini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his tam periculosis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 19, 31</bibl></cit>.—Esp., of the prætor, <hi rend="ital">to render official</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judicial aid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequissimum erit praetorem ei subvenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:7:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 7, § 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subveniri generi humano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:4:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">D. Bruti operā, etc. ... provinciae Galliae esse subventum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic quoque rei subventum est maxime a nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi celeriter sociis foret subventum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 26:4" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 26, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46212.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">et defendam et subvenibo sedulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">age, fi benignus, subveni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumvenior, judices, nisi subvenitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:260" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 75, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum orare, ut subveniret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:27:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 27, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et subventuros auferet unda deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 28</bibl></cit>;
