<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 72</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam ex castris subveniretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 54:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 54, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni subveniatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi in tempore subventum foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:25" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46212.3" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to come up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n46212.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: aliud in eo (sale) mirabile est, quod tantundem nocte <cb n="SUBV" /> subvenit, quantum die auferas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 39, § 74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46212.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46212.6" n="1" level="3"> Ut quaeque vox digna animadverti subvenerat, memoriae mandabamus, <hi rend="ital">came to mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occurred to us</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46212.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To come to one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occur</hi> to him; with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 131, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subventio: <entryFree id="n46213" type="main" key="subventi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subventĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subvenio</etym>, <sense id="n46213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rendering aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistance</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subvento: <entryFree id="n46214" type="hapax" key="subvento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subvento</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n46214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to come with assistance</hi> to one: <cit><quote lang="la">spes bona, opsecro, subventa mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subventor: <entryFree id="n46215" type="gloss" key="subventor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subventor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who comes in aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a helper</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">CIVIVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">POPVLI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3766</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subventralis: <entryFree id="n46216" type="main" key="subventra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subventrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sub-venter</etym>, <sense id="n46216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">subventral</hi>, med. t. t., Ps. - Soran. Quaest. Med. 235.</sense></entryFree>
subventrile: <entryFree id="n46217" type="main" key="subventri_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-ventrīle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the lower belly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the abdomen</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <foreign lang="greek">u(pokoi/lion,</foreign> sumen, subventrile, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
subverbustus: <entryFree id="n46218" type="main" key="subverbustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subverbustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perhaps contr. from sub verubus ustus</etym>, <sense id="n46218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">branded under the spear</hi>, an epithet of a male or female slave (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">subverbustam veribus ustam significat Plautus cum ait: ulcerosam, compeditam, subverbustam, sordidam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=309" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 309</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
subvereor: <entryFree id="n46219" type="main" key="subve^re^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vĕrĕor</orth>, <itype>ēri</itype>, <sense id="n46219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be somewhat fearful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">apprehensive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subvereri ne te delectet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subversio: <entryFree id="n46220" type="main" key="subversi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subversĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>subverto</etym>, <sense id="n46220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overturn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">humani generis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:19:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 19, 29</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 165</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subverso: <entryFree id="n46221" type="hapax" key="subverso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subverso</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-vorso</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to overturn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subversor: <entryFree id="n46222" type="main" key="subversor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subversor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an overturner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subverter</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">legum (opp. auctor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae (diabolus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 2, 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subversus: <entryFree id="n46223" type="main" key="subversus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subversus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of subverto.</entryFree>
subverto: <entryFree id="n46224" type="main" key="subverto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-verto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-vorto</orth>), <itype>ti, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn upside down; to upset</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overturn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n46224.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupinum aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:44" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantas operum moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:645" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 645</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subversi montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arisbe terrarum motu subversa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 39, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Silvani simulacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 18, 20, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obices portarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 39</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:13:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 13, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calceus olim Si pede major erit, subvertet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 43</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46224.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subvert</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subversa jacebat Pristina majestas soliorum,</quote> <trans><tr>overthrown</tr>, <tr>subverted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subversa Crassorum et Orphiti domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florentes privignos per occultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 71 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to ruin</tr>, <tr>undo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritia fidem, probitatem ceterasque artes bonas subvertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges ac libertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:48:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 48, 10</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 1:48:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 48, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ea quae majores pepererunt, subvortunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 1:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 41, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decretum consulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptam legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia praejudicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpretationem adversarii (opp. confirmare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:6:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artem orandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:8:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquiora beneficia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis domus delatorum interpretationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesitum imperium brevis momenti culpā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:3:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subvespertinus: <entryFree id="n46225" type="hapax" key="subvesperti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vespertīnus</orth> <itype>ventus</itype>, <sense id="n46225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the southwest wind</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 5, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subvesperus: <entryFree id="n46226" type="hapax" key="subvespe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vespĕrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. ventus), <sense id="n46226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the southwest-by-west wind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
subvestio: <entryFree id="n46227" type="main" key="subvesti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vestĭo</orth>, <itype>īre, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to clothe from beneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clothe by degrees</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nova subvestit reparatas pluma volucres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Dracont.</author> 1, 642</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subvexus: <entryFree id="n46228" type="hapax" key="subvexus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subvexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>subveho</etym>, <sense id="n46228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sloping upwards</hi> (opp. devexus): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia fastigio leni subvexa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subvilicus: <entryFree id="n46229" type="gloss" key="subvi_li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vīlĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an under-steward</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">HORTORVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2860</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subviridis: <entryFree id="n46230" type="main" key="subvi^ri^dis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vĭrĭdis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat green</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greenish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 65, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balanitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 55, § 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emplastrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 201" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 201</bibl></cit> and 202.</sense></entryFree>
subvolo: <entryFree id="n46231" type="main" key="subvo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vŏlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fly up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upwards</hi> (rare but class.): hae (partes corporum)<cb n="SUCC" />  sursum in caelestem locum subvo lent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:790" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 790</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex agmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:507" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 507</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praepes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:577" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 577</bibl></cit>: ad capita, Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 6:3" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 6, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subvolsus: <entryFree id="n46232" type="main" key="subvolsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">subvolsus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">subvulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of subvello.</entryFree>
subvolvo: <entryFree id="n46233" type="hapax" key="subvolvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-volvo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to roll up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">along</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibus saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 424</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
subvulturius: <entryFree id="n46234" type="hapax" key="subvultu^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sub-vultŭrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat vulture-like</hi>, a facetiously formed word: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sucasini: <entryFree id="n46235" type="main" key="Sucasi_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sucasīni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Succas-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of the Interamnates on the Liris in Latium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succabar: <entryFree id="n46236" type="main" key="Succabar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Succabar</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n46236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Mauritania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 2, 1, § 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succaelestis: <entryFree id="n46237" type="main" key="succaelestis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-caelestis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which is under the heavens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subcelestial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sublunary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hebdomas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succaeruleus: <entryFree id="n46238" type="hapax" key="succaeru^le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-caerŭlĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat blue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bluish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">creta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
succandidus: <entryFree id="n46239" type="main" key="succandi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-candĭdus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat white</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whitish</hi> (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 39, § 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:120" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 12, 94, § 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succasini: <entryFree id="n46240" type="main" key="Succasi_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Succasīni</orth>, v. Sucasini.</entryFree>
succasses: <entryFree id="n46241" type="main" key="Succasses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Succasses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Gaul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succavus: <entryFree id="n46242" type="main" key="succa^vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-căvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hollow below</hi> or <hi rend="ital">underneath</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">areae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 151, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 557</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. Limit. pp. 252, 260, 303 Goes.: natura Aetnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:682" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 682</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succedaneus: <entryFree id="n46243" type="main" key="succe_da_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succēdānĕus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">succīdāneus</orth> (on the latter very ancient orthog. cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:6:4 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 6, 4 sq.</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>succedo</etym>, <sense id="n46243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that follows after</hi> or <hi rend="ital">succeeds to</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">that supplies the place of</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">substituted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succedaneous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostia, quae ad aras adducta est immolanda, si casu effugeret, effugia vocari veteri more solet: in cujus locum quae supposita fuerat, succidanea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 140</bibl></cit>; cf. Gell. l. l.; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=302" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 302</bibl> Müll.: si quid succidaneis opus esset, robus succederet, S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:6:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">asinus pro homine succidaneus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 213, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut meum tergum stultitiae tuae subdas succidaneum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subrogare aliquem succedaneum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 11, 65, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avum suum Pharnacem succedaneum regi Pergameno Eumeni datum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:6:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">succēdānĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a substitute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">representative;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:8:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">functionis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 31, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alieni periculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
succedo: <entryFree id="n46244" type="main" key="succe_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cēdo</orth>, <itype>cessi, cessum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n46244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [sub]. </sense><sense id="n46244.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To go below</hi> or <hi rend="ital">under</hi> (so mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; syn. subeo). </sense><sense id="n46244.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46244.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to enter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come under</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul ac primum nubes succedere soli Coepere,</quote> <trans><tr>to go under the sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 286</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 402</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectum, cui imbris vitandi causā succederet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:44:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 44, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maestae Succedunt ramis volucres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:505" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 505</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succedere tectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:766" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 766</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:549" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 549</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 627</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex jussae succedit aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecto et umbrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 418</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 5, 6</bibl></cit> and 19: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulo sineret succedere terrae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be buried</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 103</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens imo Successit tumulo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46244.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to go from under; to go up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alto caelo,</quote> <trans><tr>to mount</tr>, <tr>ascend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in arduum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc itinere est fons, quo mare succedit longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 18, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 45, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:597" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 597</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 28</bibl></cit> et saep. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">erigi scalas jussit ac promptissimum quemque succedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 81</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in montem succedere silvas Cogebant,</quote> <trans><tr>to retreat to the mountains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1370</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46244.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46244.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To come under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submit to</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes sententiae verbaque omnia ... sub acumen stili subeant et succedant necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">externae dominationi, quam in suis timuerunt, sponte succedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succedoque oneri,</quote> <trans><tr>take up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 723</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec qui succederet operi inventus est,</quote> <trans><tr>undertake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46244.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To go up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a pedibusque minutatim succedere frigus Non dubitabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad summum honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille ad superos Succedet famā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum in summum successit honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1275</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46244.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To approach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw near</hi> (class. and freq.). </sense><sense id="n46244.9" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to march on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">march up to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approach</hi> (class. and freq.; cf.: invado, progredior): <pb n="1787" /> <cb n="SUCC" /> sub primam nostram aciem successerunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub montem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: supra hostium munitionem, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 91, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad castra hostium infestis signis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad stationes hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hostium latebras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub ipsum vallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 36, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad portūs claustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeriter ad molem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:19" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">munimentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitionibus, Auct. B. Alex. 30, 4: portas succedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 9</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis paulatim successit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubicumque iniquo successum est loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46244.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">follow after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take the place of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relieve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">come into the place of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeed; to succeed to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">receive by succession</hi> (syn. subsequor). </sense><sense id="n46244.11" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut integri et recentes defatigatis succederent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 94</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in stationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 27</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in paternas opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Pompeii locum heres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Sequani principatum dimiserant. In eorum locum Remi successerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego in ejus quem occidissem succederem locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 12, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succedam ego vicarius tuo muneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:37:section=81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 37, § 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 51, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 3, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 14, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui regno successit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 27, 70, § 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post ejus mortem frater regno successit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:3:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hujus locum filia regno successit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but: in regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic Mithridates filius succedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 42, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad alteram partem succedunt Ubii,</quote> <trans><tr>follow</tr>, <tr>come next</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">aspicit in teretes lignum succedere suras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 80</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum, quod tibi succederetur, sed quod Gabinio non succederetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te antea, quam tibi successum esset, decessurum fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46244.12" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46244.13" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To come</hi> or <hi rend="ital">enter into</hi> a relation: <cit><quote lang="la">in affinitatis jura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:3:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46244.14" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">follow after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46244.15" n="(a)" level="5"> In time: <cit><quote lang="la">successit ipse magnis (oratoribus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:30:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 30, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum aetati successit Isocrates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil semper floret: aetas succedit aetati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertia post illas successit aënea proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum priores duae probationi succedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Italiā violis succedit rosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 39, § 68</bibl></cit>: etenim ei succedo orationi, quae, etc., <hi rend="ital">I succeed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I speak after an oration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules, quo majori gloriae rerum gestarum succedere se cernebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex ... succedens tantae caritati Hieronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut bono succedenti regi difficilis aemulatio esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 48, 8</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46244.16" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To follow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take the place of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeed</hi> in value: cujus (purpurae) libra denariis centum venibat ... huic successit dibapha Tyria, quae in libras denariis mille non poterat emi, Nep. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 39, 63, § 137</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vicem ejus (graminis) succedit decoctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 118, § 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non numero tantum amissorum civium, sed et dignitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filii magnitudini patris successerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">male gestis rebus alterius successum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 18, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46244.17" n="c" level="4"> Hence, <hi rend="ital">to follow</hi> the nature or rule of any thing, <hi rend="ital">to belong to</hi> a class or category (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">succedere hanc quoque comparativo generi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:10:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae omnia succedunt legitimis quaestionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46244.18" n="d" level="4"> Pregn.: res (alicui) succedit, or simply succedit, <hi rend="ital">goes on well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is successful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prospers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeeds</hi> (cf. evenit): <cit><quote lang="la">lepide hoc succedit sub manus negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium (ei) sub manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando hoc bene successit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum succedit, quod ago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleraque non succedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod res nulla successerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inceptum non succedebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil conceptae temere spei succedebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voti Phoebus succedere partem Mente dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:794" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 794</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si prospere prima successerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:3:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac non successit: aliā ingrediemur viā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando minus succedet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 28, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ex sententiā successerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: si proinde, ut ipse mereor, mihi successerit, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si successisset coeptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inceptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38</bibl></cit>, <cb n="SUCC" /> 25: <cit><quote lang="la">facinori eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 11</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">successurumque Minervae Indoluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:788" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 788</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: cum omnia meā causā velles mihi successa, Cic. Fil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolle successum non patribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubicumque iniquo successum erat loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 31, 13</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
succendo: <entryFree id="n46245" type="main" key="succendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cendo</orth>, <itype>di, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sub-candeo; v. accendo</etym>, <sense id="n46245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to kindle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set on fire from below</hi> (syn. inflammo). </sense><sense id="n46245.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">(sapiens) etiamsi in Phalaridis tauro inclusus succensis ignibus torreatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aggerem cuniculo hostes succenderant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma cumulata in ingentem acervum ipse imperator face subditā succendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:1:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinus duabus manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem suis manibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër fulminibus succenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 269</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:413" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 413</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 790" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 790</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46245.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to inflame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">redden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi rubor igneus ora Succendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:792" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 792</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purpura infecit niveos vultus per liquidas succensa genas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 274</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46245.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to kindle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflame</hi> with passion, etc. (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">succenseo): succendit Castora Phoebe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deucalion Pyrrhae succensus amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altera succensa cupidine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriā succensa senectā (i. e. amore patris senis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 19</bibl></cit> (4, 18), 15: <cit><quote lang="la">(furorem) succendunt classica cantu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 166</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in bella succensi mero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 779" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 779</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succensas agit libido mentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 541" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hippol. 541</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succensi irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:169" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctu succensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:585" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 585</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcedine famae succensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:40" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens facibus pudoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 221</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succeno: <entryFree id="n46246" type="hapax" key="succe_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cēno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-, succoe-</orth>), <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to eat below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dine underneath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galba de piscibus, qui cum pridie ex parte adesi et versati postero die appositi essent, Festinemus, alii subscenant, inquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:90" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 90</bibl></cit> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
succenseo: <entryFree id="n46247" type="main" key="succense^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succensĕo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">suscensĕo</orth>, <itype>sŭi, sum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>succensus, from succendo</etym>, <sense id="n46247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be inflamed with anger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be angry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irritated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enraged</hi> (class.; syn.: irascor, indignor). </sense><sense id="n46247.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominibus irasci et succensere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque illi sum iratus neque quicquam succenseo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id tibi suscensui, Quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil succenseo Nec tibi nec huic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tu illi succenseas, ne tibi illum succensere aliquid suspicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero iis ... habeo quod suscenseam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi Atheniensibus succensuissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:20:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 20, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis mihi jure succenseat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non esse aut ipsi aut militibus succensendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46247.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil fecit quod succenseas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae si sic sua habituram dicat, quis tandem succenseat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud succensendi tempus erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Caesar succensens propter curam verrendis viis non adhibitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl></cit>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 3, 17.— * </sense><sense id="n46247.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Part. fut. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccata hominum non succensenda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:2:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succensio: <entryFree id="n46248" type="main" key="succensi^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>succendo</etym>, <sense id="n46248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a setting on fire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindling</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">lavacri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a heating</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prunarum nimia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 25, 10, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matutina succensio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46249" type="hapax" key="succensi^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>succenseo</etym>, <sense id="n46249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">anger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irritation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indignation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam succensionis obliterare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 5:35" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 5, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succensus: <entryFree id="n46250" type="main" key="succensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succensus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <sense id="n46250.0" n="I" level="1"> <mood>Part.</mood> from succendo.—</sense><sense id="n46250.1" n="II" level="1"> <mood>Part.</mood> from succenseo.</sense></entryFree>
succentivus: <entryFree id="n46251" type="main" key="succenti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succentīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>succino</etym>, <sense id="n46251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sounding to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accompanying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succentor: <entryFree id="n46252" type="main" key="succentor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succentor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an accompanier</hi> in singing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Enarr. in Psa. 87:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Enarr. in Psa. 87, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 7, 12, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46252.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a furtherer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promoter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabularum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 12, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 19, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succenturio: <entryFree id="n46253" type="main" key="succentu^ri^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-centŭrĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), no <sense id="n46253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to receive as a recruit into a</hi> centuria; hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">to put in the place of</hi> another, <hi rend="ital">receive as a substitute</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">succenturiare est explendae centuriae gratiā supplere, subicere, Plaut. ap. Saturione: succenturia, centum require, qui te delectent domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=306" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 306</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cb n="SUCC" /> nunc prior adito tu, ego in insidiis hic ere Succenturiatus, si quid deficies, <hi rend="ital">as a reserve</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 55</bibl>; cf.: tota metaphora de re militari est. Succenturiati dicuntur, qui explendae centuriae gratiā subiciunt se ad supplementum ordinum, Don. ad. h. l.: et alia esca melior atque amplior succenturietur, Favor. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:8:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 8, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46254" type="main" key="succentu^ri^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-centŭrĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an under-officer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sub-centurion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succentus: <entryFree id="n46255" type="hapax" key="succentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succentus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>succino</etym>, <sense id="n46255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an accompanying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accompaniment</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succerno: <entryFree id="n46256" type="main" key="succerno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cerno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>crēvi, crētum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sift through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sift.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46256.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinaceos cottidie recentes succernito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18, 7</bibl>; 151, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 29, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 5</bibl>.—Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">iste gradus succretu'st cribro pollinario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n46256.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to shake up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitate</hi>, Sev. Aetna, 492.</sense></entryFree>
successio: <entryFree id="n46257" type="main" key="successi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">successĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>succedo, II.</etym>. <sense id="n46257.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A coming into the place of</hi> another, <hi rend="ital">a following after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeeding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succession</hi> in office, possession, etc. (mostly post-Aug.): si merces Antonii oppressi poscitur in Antonii locum successio, Brut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 17, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neronis principis successio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 13, 11, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum non dubia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad spem successionis admoveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 210, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 23, 17</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratibus judicia per annuas successiones permisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiae, quae per successiones jus sibi vindicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 14, 30, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbi per successiones quasdam traduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura successionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris amotio successionem afficit voluptatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n46257.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A good issue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">success</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">successio prospera consecuta est, Aug. (perh. Cic. Hort. Fragm.) Vit. Beat. 26: victoriam proeliorum successionibus relaturos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
successivus: <entryFree id="n46258" type="spur" key="successi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">successīvus</orth>, a false read. for succissiva, Lact. Opif. Dei, 12, 15 Bünem. ad loc.</entryFree>
successor: <entryFree id="n46259" type="main" key="successor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">successor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>succedo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n46259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a follower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">successor</hi> in office, possession, time, etc. (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vicarius): conjunctissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">successori decessor invidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:Fragm. 33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Scaur. Fragm. 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 15, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 14, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">successorem alicui mittere,</quote> <trans><tr>to remove from office</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 27, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 28, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legato eum consulari successorem dedisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:88" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">successorem accipere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be removed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:13:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">successores Alexandri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studii successor et heres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:589" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 589</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo successore (Philoctete) sagittae Herculis utuntur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the succeeding possessor</tr>, <tr>inheritor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alieni criminis successor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">successore novo vincitur omnis amor,</quote> <trans><tr>by a new favorite</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 462</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">novus habendus (clipeo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propositi successor honoris Junius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 77</bibl></cit>: successor fuit hic tibi, Galle; <cit><quote lang="la">Propertius illi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>he followed you</tr>, <tr>wrote after you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 53</bibl></cit>.—Of a female: Phoebe, Fraternis successor equis, Corn. Sev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 66</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
successorius: <entryFree id="n46260" type="main" key="successo_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">successōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>successor</etym>, <sense id="n46260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to succession</hi>, <hi rend="ital">successory</hi> (post-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in jurid. Lat.): de successorio edicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:9:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 9, 1</bibl></cit> pr.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex successorio capite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:6:1:section=3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 22, 6, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">successorio jure aliquid tenere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 8, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
successus: <entryFree id="n46261" type="main" key="successus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">successus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of succedo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46262" type="main" key="successus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">successus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>succedo</etym>. <sense id="n46262.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to succedo, I.) <hi rend="ital">An advance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">approach</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n46262.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">successus et incursus hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 616</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46262.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (post-class.), a place which one goes down into, <hi rend="ital">a cavern</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 173</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 251</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46262.3" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to succedo, II.) <hi rend="ital">A succession</hi> of time, <hi rend="ital">continuance</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">continuo totius temporis successu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:8:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex successu continuae felicitatis obliviscitur se hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:5:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46262.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a happy issue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good result</hi>, <hi rend="ital">success</hi> (the usual signif.; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. not ante-Aug.): successu exsultans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mnestheus successu acrior ipso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos successus alit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">successum dea dira negat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 914</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multo successu Fabiis audaciam crescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:50:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 50, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentus fortuito successu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:66:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 66, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elatus successu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 3: successumque artes non habuere meae, Ov. R. <pb n="1788" /> <cb n="SUCC" /> Am. 624: <cit><quote lang="la">successu rerum ferocior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 130</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 384</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 495 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">successus improborum plures allicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:13" default="NO">10, 7, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 7, 5, § 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">petitionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 9, 36, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec successum victoriae moderatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantusque rerum successu haberi coeptus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:3:22" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">successu rerum florentes opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:6:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 18, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:6:1" default="NO">21, 6, 1</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleni successibus anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">successus prosperos dare, Liv. prooem. § 13: ne successibus deesset auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46262.5" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">posterity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">issue</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ferunt Graecorum commenta ... feminam ... suā manu suos exstinxisse successus, i. e. Medea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succi: <entryFree id="n46263" type="main" key="Succi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Succi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Thrace</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 7, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succidaneus: <entryFree id="n46264" type="main" key="succi_da_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succīdānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. succedaneus, <sense id="n46264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
succidia: <entryFree id="n46265" type="main" key="succi_di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succīdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. succido</etym>. <sense id="n46265.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A leg</hi> or <hi rend="ital">side of meat cut off</hi>, esp. of pork; <hi rend="ital">a leg of pork</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flitch of bacon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L.L. 5:section=110" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L.L. 5, § 110</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam hortum ipsi agricolae succidiam alteram appellant,</quote> <trans><tr>their second flitch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 56</bibl></cit>. — * </sense><sense id="n46265.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a slaughtering</hi>: succidias humanas facere, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succido: <entryFree id="n46266" type="main" key="succi^do1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cĭdo</orth>, <itype>ĭdi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>sub-cado</etym>, <sense id="n46266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fall under</hi> any thing. * </sense><sense id="n46266.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">lorica quod e loris de corio crudo pectoralia faciebant: postea succidit Gallica e ferro sub id vocabulum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>were comprehended under the word</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=116" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 116</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n46266.2" n="II" level="1"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to sink under one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sink down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sink</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n46266.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">genua inedia succidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 30</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia fragore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra repente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 482</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mediis conatibus aegri Succidimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:911" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 911</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperfecta sublabantur aut succidant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:35" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuo labore gravia genua succiderant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 5, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46266.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens succidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendax Dardania domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 863" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Agam. 863</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46267" type="main" key="succi_do2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cīdo</orth>, <itype>cīdi, cīsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sub-caedo</etym>, <sense id="n46267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut from below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cut through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fell</hi> (rare but class.; not in Cic.): is pernas succidit iniquā superbiā Poeni, Enn. ap. Fest. pp. 304 and 305 Müll. (Ann. v. 279 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vivos Succisis feminibus poplitibusque invenerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:51:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 51, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poplitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 700</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura equis (with suffodere ilia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:59:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 59, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervos equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 28, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
