G. 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:11" default="NO">11, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:58 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 12, 23, § 58 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">asseres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florem aratro, Verg.A.9,435: frumentis succisis,</quote> <trans><tr>cut down</tr>, <tr>mown down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cererem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 297</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(herbas) curvamine falcis aënae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:536 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 536 al.</bibl></cit>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ita gregem metite imbellem ac succidite ferro,</quote> <trans><tr>mow down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:134" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens succisa manu Herculeā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 702" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 702</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">succisa libido,</quote> <trans><tr>emasculated</tr>, <tr>made powerless</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 190</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succidus: <entryFree id="n46268" type="main" key="succi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. sucidus.</entryFree>
succiduus: <entryFree id="n46269" type="main" key="succi^du^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succĭdŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. succido</etym>, <sense id="n46269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sinking down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">failing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n46269.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">genu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poples,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 458</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:661" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 116</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n46269.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">benedictio,</quote> <trans><tr>faltering</tr>, <tr>trembling</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n46269.3" n="III" level="1"> = succidaneus (late Lat.), Ven. Misc. 4, 25, 10.</sense></entryFree>
succincte: <entryFree id="n46270" type="main" key="succincte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succinctē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. succingo, <sense id="n46270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
succinctim: <entryFree id="n46271" type="hapax" key="succinctim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succinctim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>succingo</etym>, <sense id="n46271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">briefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succinctly</hi>: denotare, Claud. Mam. Stat. Anim. praef.</sense></entryFree>
succinctio: <entryFree id="n46272" type="main" key="succincti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succinctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>,<gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a girding about</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. c. Jul. 2, 6.</sense></entryFree>
succinctorium: <entryFree id="n46273" type="main" key="succincto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succinctōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an apron</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Gen. adv. Manich. 2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Gen. adv. Manich. 2</bibl>. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. Verb. Dom. 10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Serm. Verb. Dom. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; id. Civ. Dei, 14, 17 al.</sense></entryFree>
succinctulus: <entryFree id="n46274" type="hapax" key="succinctu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succinctŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n46274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [succinctus], <hi rend="ital">girded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">girt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasciola,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 117, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succinctus: <entryFree id="n46275" type="main" key="succinctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n46275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Part. and P. a.</hi> of succingo.</sense></entryFree>
succinerarius: <entryFree id="n46276" type="main" key="succi^ne^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cĭnĕrārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sub-cinis</etym>, = succinericius, panis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Hos. 2, 8, 7 al.</bibl></entryFree>
succinericius: <entryFree id="n46277" type="main" key="succine^ri_cius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cinĕrīcius</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prepared under the ashes</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <trans><tr>baked under the ashes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 18</bibl></cit>, <cb n="SUCC" /> 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Exod. 12, 39</bibl>; id. Osee, 7, 8 al.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succineus: <entryFree id="n46278" type="main" key="succi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. sucineus.</entryFree>
succingo: <entryFree id="n46279" type="main" key="succingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cingo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>nxi, nctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to gird below</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tuck up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gird</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gird about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">girdle</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose; cf. subligo). </sense><sense id="n46279.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">crure tenus medio tunicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:455" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astricti succingant ilia ventres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 271</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Virginem et Leonem Anguis intortus succingit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 5</bibl></cit> (7), 1: <cit><quote lang="la">illa (Scylla) feris atram canibus succingitur alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:732" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 732</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:892" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 892</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:89" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eāpse sic succincta,</quote> <trans><tr>tucked up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:46:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 46, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">popa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 62: <cit><quote lang="la">cursor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:24:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 24, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:156" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 156</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem ritu succincta Dianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:536" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 536</bibl></cit>; 9, 89.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">succincta comas pinus,</quote> <trans><tr>with its bare trunk</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 603</bibl>: quis illaec est, quae lugubri Succincta est stolā, <hi rend="ital">girt about</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 198, 2</bibl> (Trag. v. 134 Vahl.): succincti gladiis mediā regione cracentes, <hi rend="ital">girt about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">armed</hi>, id. ap. Fest. s. v. cracentes, p. 53 (Ann. v. 497 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">gladio succinctus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 52, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succinctam pharetrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallā succincta cruenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 555</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">amictu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12,401</bibl></cit>: succincti corda machaeris, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 9, 678</bibl> (Ann. v. 392 ib.): pugione succinctus, Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:16:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 16, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultro succinctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 9, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 7, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46279.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fit out</hi> with any thing (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">saepio, circumdo): quod multo se pluribus et majoribus canibus succinxerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:56:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 56, § 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustra se terrore succinxerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:49:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 49, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his animum succinge bonis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succinctam latrantibus inguina monstris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scylla rapax canibus succincta Molossis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cul. 330</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgineam canibus succincta figuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:89" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthago succincta portubus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 32, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succinctus armis legionibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximarum gentium viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius ferme Orientis viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 35, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum scientiā debet esse succinctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriā papyro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:24" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 24</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">succinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (very rare and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n46279.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Prepared</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ready</hi> for any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">proni atque succincti ad omnem clausulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46279.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Contracted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">short</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succinct</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">brevis, circumscriptus): libelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores succinctiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 17, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succinctior brevitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 157" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 157</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.—Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cinctē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">briefly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concisely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succinctly</hi> (late Lat.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">breviter, strictim): docere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimicare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 11, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succingulum: <entryFree id="n46280" type="hapax" key="succingu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succingŭlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>succingo</etym>, <sense id="n46280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an under-girdle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lower girdle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=302" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 302</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
succino: <entryFree id="n46281" type="main" key="succi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cĭno</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">succăno</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=75" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 75</bibl> Müll.), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cano</etym>, <sense id="n46281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sing to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accompany</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n46281.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubicines imitatus est succinente Habinnā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 69, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantibus iste tuis alterno succinet ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:79" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46281.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to accord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(agricultura) succinit pastorali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamat: Victum date. Succinit alter: Et mihi, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>another chimes in</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succinum: <entryFree id="n46282" type="main" key="succi^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. sucinum.</entryFree>
succinus: <entryFree id="n46283" type="main" key="succi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. sucinus.</entryFree>
succipio: <entryFree id="n46284" type="main" key="succi^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. suscipio <sense id="n46284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
succisio: <entryFree id="n46285" type="hapax" key="succi_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succīsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. succido</etym>, <sense id="n46285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cutting off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cottidiana pilorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succisivus: <entryFree id="n46286" type="main" key="succi_si_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succīsīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. subsecivus.</entryFree>
succisor: <entryFree id="n46287" type="main" key="succi_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succīsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. succido</etym>, <sense id="n46287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who cuts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prunes</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">quam (silvam) nec si serā succisor falce repurget,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Ep. 4, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succisus: <entryFree id="n46288" type="main" key="succi_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of 2. succido.</entryFree>
succlamatio: <entryFree id="n46289" type="main" key="succla_ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succlāmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>succlamo</etym>, <sense id="n46289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a calling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crying out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a shouting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acclamation</hi> after any thing (rare; perh. not anteAug.); only <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultro territuri succlamationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 26, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 36, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 28, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succlamo: <entryFree id="n46290" type="main" key="succla_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-clāmo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to call</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cry out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exclaim</hi> after or in reply to any thing (not in Cic. or Cæs.); with <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec Virginio vociferanti succlamabat multitudo, nec illius dolori nec suae libertati se defuturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 50, 10</bibl></cit>: <cb n="SUCC" /> quidam ausi sunt mediā ex contione succlamare: <cit><quote lang="la">Abite hinc, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si esset libera haec civitas, non tibi succlamassent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum centuria fre quens succlamasset, nihil se mutare sententiae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 22, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui dicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:2:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: succlamatum est, et frequenter a militibus Ventidianis, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hoc cum succlamatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:18" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:53" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 53</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n46290.1" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">publicā succlamatus invidiā,</quote> <trans><tr>cried out against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 18:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 18, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium maledictis succlamatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 19:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succlausus: <entryFree id="n46291" type="main" key="succlausus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succlausus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sub-claudo</etym>, <sense id="n46291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-closed</hi> [Appul.], Polem. Physiogn. p. 128.</sense></entryFree>
succlino: <entryFree id="n46292" type="main" key="succli_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succlīno</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>sub-clino</etym>, <sense id="n46292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">incline somewhat</hi>, Ven. Fort. Ep. Praem. Carm. 5, l<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succo: <entryFree id="n46293" type="main" key="succo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. suco.</entryFree>
succoelestis: <entryFree id="n46294" type="main" key="succoelestis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-coelestis</orth>, v. succaelestis.</entryFree>
succoeno: <entryFree id="n46295" type="hapax" key="succoeno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-coeno</orth>, v. succeno.</entryFree>
succoeruleus: <entryFree id="n46296" type="main" key="succoeru^le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succoerŭlĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. succaer-.</entryFree>
succollo: <entryFree id="n46297" type="main" key="succollo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-collo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>collum</etym>, <sense id="n46297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take upon the neck</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shoulder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shoulder</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">apes fessum (regem) sublevant, et si nequit volare, succollant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 8</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">attollunt umeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 217</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">vicissim succollantibus (lecticam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 10 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succollatus et a praesente comitatu imperator consalutatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succonditor: <entryFree id="n46298" type="gloss" key="succondi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-condĭtor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inferior officer in the Circensian games</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 339, 5</bibl>, and 340, 3.</sense></entryFree>
succontumeliose: <entryFree id="n46299" type="hapax" key="succontu^me_li^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-contŭmēlĭōsē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n46299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat insolently</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contumeliously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succoquo: <entryFree id="n46300" type="hapax" key="succo^quo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cŏquo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cook a little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia igni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 36 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
succoriatio: <entryFree id="n46301" type="main" key="succo^ri^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succŏrĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sub-corium</etym>; med. t. t., <sense id="n46301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an operating beneath the skin</hi> (late Lat.), Ps.-Soran. Quaest. Medic. 245.</sense></entryFree>
succornicularius: <entryFree id="n46302" type="gloss" key="succorni^cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cornĭcŭlārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sub-adjutant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">second adjutant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3490</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succortex: <entryFree id="n46303" type="hapax" key="succortex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cortex</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the under</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inner bark</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 4, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succosus: <entryFree id="n46304" type="main" key="succo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. sucosus.</entryFree>
succrassulus: <entryFree id="n46305" type="hapax" key="succrassu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-crassŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n46305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [crassus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat thick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thickish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis qualitate succrassulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succrepo: <entryFree id="n46306" type="main" key="succre^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-crĕpo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to crackle beneath</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Vit. Beat. 3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Vit. Beat. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succresco: <entryFree id="n46307" type="main" key="succresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cresco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n46307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow under</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from under</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to grow up</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n46307.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub ordine naturali pilorum (in palpebris) alius ordo succrescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succrescit ab imo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne patiantur herbam succrescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:14:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mores mali, Quasi herba irrigua, succrevere uberrime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46307.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to grow up</hi> to any thing: toties haustum cratera repleri Sponte suā, per seque vident succrescere vina, <hi rend="ital">to spring up</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">be supplied anew</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 680</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46307.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: non enim ille mediocris orator vestrae quasi succrescit aetati, <hi rend="ital">grows up after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succeeds</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:61:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 61, 230</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se gloriae seniorum succrevisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 13, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succretus: <entryFree id="n46308" type="main" key="succre_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succrētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of succerno.</entryFree>
succrispus: <entryFree id="n46309" type="main" key="succrispus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-crispus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat curled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frizzled</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">crisped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:44:section=108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 44, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juba equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars inferior caudae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:5:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succrotillus: <entryFree id="n46310" type="main" key="succrotillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-crotillus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delicate</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">succrotilla vox tenuis et alta. Titinnius: femina fabulare succrotillā voculā. Afranius in epistulā: loquebatur succrotillā voce serio. Plautus in describendis mulierum cruribus gracilibus in Syro: cum extortis talis, cum succrotillis crusculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=301" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 301</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
succrudus: <entryFree id="n46311" type="main" key="succru_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-crūdus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat raw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half raw</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">brassica,</quote> <trans><tr>parboiled</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succrudum incidendum ne, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>not fully ripe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succruentus: <entryFree id="n46312" type="main" key="succru^entus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-crŭentus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat bloody</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">livor facie contusā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 18, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succuba: <entryFree id="n46313" type="main" key="succu^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succŭba</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>1. succubo</etym>. <sense id="n46313.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who lies under;</hi> hence, in mal. part., <hi rend="ital">a lecher</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strumpet</hi> (post-class.): florulentus,<pb n="1789" /> <cb n="SUCC" />  Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 192; cf. 2. succubo.—</sense><sense id="n46313.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a supplanter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rival</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 171, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl></cit>, p. 250, 18.</sense></entryFree>
succubo: <entryFree id="n46314" type="main" key="succu^bo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cŭbo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lie under</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">grabatulo succubans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 107, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alveum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, p. 229, 30.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46315" type="main" key="succu^bo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cŭbo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cubo</etym>, <sense id="n46315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who lies under;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">a lecher</hi>, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 224, 22</bibl> (but Com. Fragm. v. 92 Rib. reads: quam arbitrer Illarum subcuboneam esse, i. e. succubam).</sense></entryFree>
succuboneus: <entryFree id="n46316" type="main" key="succu^bo_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succŭbōnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2 succubo.</entryFree>
succulentus: <entryFree id="n46317" type="main" key="succu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. suculentus.</entryFree>
succultro: <entryFree id="n46318" type="main" key="succultro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cultro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), no <sense id="n46318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>culter</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to cut up with a knife</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to chop up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mince</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">pulpas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thymum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
succumbo: <entryFree id="n46319" type="main" key="succumbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cumbo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>cŭbŭi, cŭbĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lay</hi> or <hi rend="ital">put one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self under</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to fall down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lie</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">sink down.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46319.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare; not in Cic.; cf. subsido). </sense><sense id="n46319.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ancipiti succumbens victima ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 370</bibl></cit>: vidit Cyllenius omnes Succubuisse oculos, <hi rend="ital">had sunk in sleep</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">had closed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 714</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Augustus) Nolae succubuit,</quote> <trans><tr>took to his bed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 98 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non succumbentibus causis operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 16</bibl> Hildebr.—</sense><sense id="n46319.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n46319.4" n="1" level="3"> Of a woman, <hi rend="ital">to lie down</hi> to a man, <hi rend="ital">to cohabit</hi> with him (cf. substerno): <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:111:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 111, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:810" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 810</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 126</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 502, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:64:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 64, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:201" default="NO">14, 201</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46319.5" n="2" level="3"> With <case>dat.</case>, of a woman, <hi rend="ital">to be a rival to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alumnae Tethyos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 177" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 177</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Astr. 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46319.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to yield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be overcome; to submit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succumb</hi> (the predom. and class. signif.; cf.: cedo, me summitto). </sense><sense id="n46319.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">philosopho succubuit orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:32:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 32, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Cannensi ruinae non succubuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arrogantiae divitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 32, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur succumbis cedisque fortunae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:17:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 17, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:25:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 25, 71</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nulli neque homini neque perturbationi animi nec fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno animo et erecto est, nec umquam succumbet inimicis, ne fortunae quidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 13, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labori, Caes. B. G, 7, 86: oneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:15:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:33:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 33, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:103" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:609" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 609</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:749" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 749</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempori,</quote> <trans><tr>to yield</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:59:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 59, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">precibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntati alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 228, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46319.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non esse viri debilitari dolore, frangi, succumbere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic (socero) subvenire volt succumbenti jam et oppresso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:26:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 26, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succubuit famae victa puella metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:810" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 810</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac ille perculsus plagā non succubuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succumbe, virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1315" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labefacta mens succubuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 950" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Troad. 950</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 161, 33</bibl>. —* </sense><sense id="n46319.9" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ipsam perpeti succubuisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succumbus: <entryFree id="n46320" type="main" key="succumbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succumbus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boundary-stone</hi>, Auct. Limit. pp. 265 and 302 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
succuneatus: <entryFree id="n46321" type="hapax" key="succu^ne^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cŭnĕātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [cuneo], <sense id="n46321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wedged underneath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supported with wedges</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succurator: <entryFree id="n46322" type="main" key="succu_ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cūrātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a subcurator</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 5, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succurro: <entryFree id="n46323" type="main" key="succurro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-curro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>curri, cursum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to run under.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46323.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46323.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: tempore eodem aliud nequeat succurrere lunae Corpus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:763" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 763</bibl>; cf.: pagus Succusanus, quod succurrit Carinis, <hi rend="ital">runs</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">lies under</hi> or <hi rend="ital">behind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=48" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 48</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n46323.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to run</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hasten to the aid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assistance of</hi> one; <hi rend="ital">to help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succor</hi> (the predom. and class, signif.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: subvenio, adjuvo, sublevo): ut laborantibus succurrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:37:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 37, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saluti fortunisque communibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succurrit illi Varenus et laboranti subvenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">afflictis semper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis cedentibus auxilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: oppido, Auct. B. Afr. 5, 1.—</sense><sense id="n46323.4" n="2" level="3"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">to be useful for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good against</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantis malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 70</bibl></cit>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Esp., of medicines: cannabis succurrit alvo jumentorum,</quote> <trans><tr>helps</tr>, <tr>relieves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 23, 97, § 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strangulationibus (crethmos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 15, 90, § 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenis fungorum (nitrum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 10, 46, § 119</bibl></cit>: dum succurrere humanis erroribus <cb n="SUCI" /> cupiunt, ipsi se in errores maximos induxerunt, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 3, 8</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se confidere munitionibus oppidi, si celeriter succurratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 27, § 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paratae lites: succurrendum'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46323.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n46323.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">licet undique omnes in me terrores periculaque impendeant omnia, succurram atque subibo,</quote> <trans><tr>I will encounter and undergo them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 11, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46323.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to come into the mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occur to</hi> one (class.; esp. freq. after the Aug. period; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. subit): ut quidque succurrit, libet scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: illud etiam mihi succurrebat, grave esse, etc., id. fil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:81" default="NO">8, 3, 81</bibl> et saep.: succurrit versus ille Homericus, etc., Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 21</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non succurrit tibi, quamdiu circum Bactra haereas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:8:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 8, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque cuiquam facile succurrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 10</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et illud annotare succurrit, unum omnino, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirari succurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:171" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 18, 51, § 171</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succursor: <entryFree id="n46324" type="gloss" key="succursor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succursor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>succurro</etym>, perh. <sense id="n46324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a helper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succorer</hi>, who comes to the aid of the bestiarius, in the combats with beasts in the circus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2530</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succurvus: <entryFree id="n46325" type="hapax" key="succurvus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-curvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat curved</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 9, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succus: <entryFree id="n46326" type="main" key="succus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. sucus.</entryFree>
succusanus: <entryFree id="n46327" type="main" key="Succusa_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Succusānus</orth> <itype>pagus</itype>, v. succurro <sense id="n46327.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
succussator: <entryFree id="n46328" type="hapax" key="succussa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succussātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>succusso</etym>, <sense id="n46328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jolter</hi>: caballus, <hi rend="ital">a jolting horse</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 16, 30</bibl>; cf. succussor.</sense></entryFree>
succussatura: <entryFree id="n46329" type="hapax" key="succussa_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succussātūra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the jolting</hi> of a hard-going horse, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 17, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succussio: <entryFree id="n46330" type="hapax" key="succussi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succussĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>succutio</etym>, <sense id="n46330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quaking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">succussio est, cum terra quatitur et sursum ac deorsum movetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:21:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 21, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
succusso: <entryFree id="n46331" type="hapax" key="succusso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succusso</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shake</hi> or <hi rend="ital">jerk up and down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to jolt</hi> (as a hard-going horse does his rider), Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 16, 29</bibl> (Trag. Rel. 568 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
succussor: <entryFree id="n46332" type="hapax" key="succussor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succussor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jolter</hi>, said of a horse: sonipes, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 16, 31</bibl>; cf. succussator.</sense></entryFree>
succussura: <entryFree id="n46333" type="hapax" key="succussu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succussūra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = succussatura, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 17, 24</bibl>.</entryFree>
succussus: <entryFree id="n46334" type="main" key="succussus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succussus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of succutio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46335" type="main" key="succussus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">succussus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>succutio</etym>, <sense id="n46335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jolting</hi>, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 48</bibl> (Trag. Rel. 257 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">membra tremulo succussu quatit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 138, 29</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 49 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
succustos: <entryFree id="n46336" type="hapax" key="succustos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-custos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ōdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an under-keeper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assistant-overseer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
succutio: <entryFree id="n46337" type="main" key="succu^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suc-cŭtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subc-</orth>), <itype>ussi, ussum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sub-quatio</etym>, <sense id="n46337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fling up from below</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fling aloft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toss up</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n46337.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbes rotarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 551</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus alte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 333</bibl></cit> et saep.—* </sense><sense id="n46337.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultūs succussus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit> ext. 5.</sense></entryFree>
sucerda: <entryFree id="n46338" type="main" key="sucerda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sucerda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sus and root skar-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">skw/r;</foreign> cf. stercus</etym>, <sense id="n46338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dung of swine</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 175, 14</bibl>; Titin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=302" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 302</bibl> Müll. (Com. Rel. v. 178 Rib.; cf. excerno, 2).</sense></entryFree>
suche: <entryFree id="n46339" type="main" key="Suche_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suchē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n46339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 34, § 172</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sucido: <entryFree id="n46340" type="main" key="su_ci^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūcĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sucus</etym>, <sense id="n46340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make fresh</hi> or <hi rend="ital">juicy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cyminum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sucidus: <entryFree id="n46341" type="main" key="su_ci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūcĭdus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">succ-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">juicy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sappy; fresh</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): solum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 289</bibl></cit>: tonsurae tempus inter aequinoctium vernum et solstitium, cum sudare inceperunt oves; <cit><quote lang="la">a quo sudore recens lana tonsa sucida appellata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:27:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 27, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:24" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=118" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 118</bibl> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">such wool was much used in medicine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 9, § 30</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and was called sucidae sordes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 2, 10, § 35</bibl></cit>: (puella) <hi rend="ital">fresh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plump</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 192</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sucinacius: <entryFree id="n46342" type="main" key="su_ci^na_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūcĭnācĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sucinum</etym>, <sense id="n46342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">amber-colored</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 20, 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sucineus: <entryFree id="n46343" type="hapax" key="su_ci^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūcĭnĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">succ-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of amber</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novaculae,</quote> <trans><tr>with amber handles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 23, 47, § 99</bibl></cit> (al. sucinas).</sense></entryFree>
sucinum: <entryFree id="n46344" type="main" key="su_ci^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūcĭnum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">succ-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sucus</etym>, <sense id="n46344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">amber</hi>, usu. called electrum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:65:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 65, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:37:11" default="NO">5, 37, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:573 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 573 al.</bibl> <cb n="SUCU" /></sense></entryFree>
sucinus: <entryFree id="n46345" type="main" key="su_ci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūcĭnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">succ-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sucinum</etym>, <sense id="n46345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of amber</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gutta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:15:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:59:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 59, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 23, 47, § 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suco: <entryFree id="n46346" type="hapax" key="su_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">succ-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sugo</etym>, <sense id="n46346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sucker;</hi> of a usurer, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 13</bibl>, b, § 5.</sense></entryFree>
sucophanta: <entryFree id="n46347" type="main" key="su_co^phanta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūcŏphanta</orth>, v. sycophanta.</entryFree>
sucositas: <entryFree id="n46348" type="hapax" key="su_co_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūcōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sucosus</etym>, <sense id="n46348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">juici ness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:29:151" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 29, 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sucosus: <entryFree id="n46349" type="main" key="su_co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūcōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">succ-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sucus</etym>, <sense id="n46349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of juice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">moisture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">juicy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sappy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succulent.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46349.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:16:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 6, 22, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 9, 70, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 13, 102, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana, i. e. sucida,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 60, 1054</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber (stirpium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 1</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n46349.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">rich</hi> in money, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 38, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sucro: <entryFree id="n46350" type="main" key="Sucro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sucro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n46350.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, now the <hi rend="ital">Xucar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46350.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town at the mouth of this river</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sueca</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:26" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:29" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:24:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 24, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:22:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 22, 7</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sucrō-nensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Sucro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:21" default="NO">2, 7, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46350.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An island near the coast of Spain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 11, § 76</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46350.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a Rutulian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 505</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suctus: <entryFree id="n46351" type="main" key="suctus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of sugo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46352" type="main" key="suctus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sugo</etym>, <sense id="n46352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sucking</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 169, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 48, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:129" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 46, 63, § 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:211" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 75, 98, § 211</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sucula: <entryFree id="n46353" type="main" key="su^cu^la1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>perh. root <foreign lang="greek">seu/w,</foreign> to drive</etym>, <sense id="n46353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of machine for drawing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lifting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a winch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">windlass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capstan</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 126</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">a wine-</hi> or <hi rend="ital">oil-press</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46354" type="hapax" key="su^cu^la2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sus</etym>, <sense id="n46354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little pig</hi>, only in paronom. with 1. sucula, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46355" type="main" key="su^cu^la3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">u(/w,</foreign> to rain</etym>, mostly <number>plur.</number> suculae, <sense id="n46355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the constellation Hyades</hi>, a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">u(a/des,</foreign> Tiro ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:9:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 39, 39, § 106</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri a similitudine cognominis Graeci propter sues impositum arbitrantes imperitiā appellavere suculas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 26, 66, § 247</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:43:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 43, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:34" default="NO">2, 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:36" default="NO">2, 2, 36</bibl>; 2, 2, 89.</sense></entryFree>
suculentus: <entryFree id="n46356" type="main" key="su_cu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūcŭlentus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">succ-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sucus</etym>, <sense id="n46356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of juice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sappy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succulent</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n46356.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gracilitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 115, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arvina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 21, 631</bibl></cit>. — * </sense><sense id="n46356.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">vigorous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">furores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 57 praef.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
suculus: <entryFree id="n46357" type="hapax" key="su^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sus</etym>, <sense id="n46357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little boar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2:1:37" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2, 1, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sucus: <entryFree id="n46358" type="main" key="su_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">succus</orth>), <itype>i</itype> (collat. form, <sense id="n46358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> sucūs, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 17, 9, 28</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> sucuum, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 244, 32</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sugo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">juice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moisture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sap</hi> (class.; cf.: liquor, latex). </sense><sense id="n46358.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46358.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpes ex terrā sucum trahunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus ex intestinis et alvo secretus a reliquo cibo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 55, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cochleae suo sibi suco vivunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambrosiae suco saturi (equi solis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 120</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ambrosiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 419</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:47" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:2:16" default="NO">4, 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus nuci expressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 28, 63, § 135</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus suci plenum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>plump</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies suci palaestrici plena,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 315, 14</bibl></cit>.—Of other liquids: <cit><quote lang="la">garo (mixtum) de sucis piscis Hiberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora suco pinguis olivi Splendescunt,</quote> <trans><tr>oil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aluntur bubuli lactis suco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 14, 14, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inbui lactis sucos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio faciendi (unguenti) duplex, sucus et corpus: ille olei generibus fere constat, hoc odorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23</bibl></cit>, praef. 2, § <cit><quote lang="la">2: candidus ovi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 1052</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46358.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a medicinal liquor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a drink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draught</hi>, <hi rend="ital">potion</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">purgantes pectora suci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:3:53" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 3, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 335</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 491</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 12, 181</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 403</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:13" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 581</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46358.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the taste</hi> of any thing, <hi rend="ital">flavor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucum sentimus in ore, cibum cum Mandendo exprimimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:615 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 615 sq.</bibl></cit> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">xumo/s</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">ova suci melioris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Picenis cedunt pomis Tiburtia suco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celantia sucum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantharus ingratus suco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:103" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 103</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46358.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">strength</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rigor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">energy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spirit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus ac sanguis (civitatis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: ingenii, Quint. prooem. § 24. — </sense><sense id="n46358.6" n="2" level="3"> Esp., of the <hi rend="ital">vigor</hi> of <pb
