n="1790" /> <cb n="SUDO" /> a discourse, <hi rend="ital">spirit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">life</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatur oratio ... suco suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus ille et sanguis incorruptus usque ad hanc aetatem oratorum fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis subtilitas etsi non plurimi sanguinis est, habeat tamen sucum aliquem oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 23, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes etiam tum retinebant illum Pericli sucum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historia quoque alere orationem quodam uberi jucundoque suco potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sudabundus: <entryFree id="n46359" type="hapax" key="su_da_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sudo</etym>, <sense id="n46359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sweating</hi>: turba, Auct. Carm. ad Pis. 176.</sense></entryFree>
sudariolum: <entryFree id="n46360" type="main" key="su_da_ri^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdārĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sudarium</etym>, <sense id="n46360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little handkerchief</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 52, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 307, 37 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
sudarium: <entryFree id="n46361" type="main" key="su_da_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sudor</etym>, <sense id="n46361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cloth for wiping off perspiration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a handkerchief</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 12, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:39:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 39, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudario candido tergere frontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:148" default="NO">11, 3, 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:12:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 309, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sudatilis: <entryFree id="n46362" type="main" key="su_da_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sudo</etym>, <sense id="n46362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing like sweat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fluid</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">metallum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 5, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sudatio: <entryFree id="n46363" type="main" key="su_da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n46363.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a sweating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perspiration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sudation</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 86:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 86, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl> —* </sense><sense id="n46363.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in concr., <hi rend="ital">a sweatingroom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sudatory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concamerata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
sudator: <entryFree id="n46364" type="hapax" key="su_da_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that perspires easily</hi> or <hi rend="ital">copiously</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 23, § 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sudatorium: <entryFree id="n46365" type="main" key="su_da_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. sudatorius, II.</entryFree>
sudatorius: <entryFree id="n46366" type="main" key="su_da_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sudo</etym>, <sense id="n46366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">serving for sweating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sudatory.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46366.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unctiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 39 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> — </sense><sense id="n46366.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a sweatingbath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sweating-room</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sudatory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa balinea ac sudatoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 7:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 51:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 51, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sudatrix: <entryFree id="n46367" type="hapax" key="su_da_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sudator</etym>, <sense id="n46367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that sweats</hi> or <hi rend="ital">causes sweating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:18:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 18, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sudiculum: <entryFree id="n46368" type="hapax" key="su_di^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdĭcŭlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sūdŭc-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sudor, producing sweat</etym>, <sense id="n46368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of whip</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scourge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=336" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 336</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
sudines: <entryFree id="n46369" type="main" key="Sudi_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sudīnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a writer on precious stones</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 56, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:59" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 7, 12, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:114 al" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 8, 35, § 114 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
sudis: <entryFree id="n46370" type="main" key="su^dis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭdis</orth> (<sense id="n46370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing.</hi> only, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 54, § 154</bibl> infra), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a stake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pile</hi> (syn.: palus, sublica). </sense><sense id="n46370.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudes stipitesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 524</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrifidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraxineae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 359</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:559" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 559</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quominus putrescerent sudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:14:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24</bibl></cit> § 101 al. — In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:299 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 299 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 174</bibl>.—As a weapon: <cit><quote lang="la">multa vulnera sudibus facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:65" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 65</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sudes in terga erectae,</quote> <trans><tr>bristles</tr>, <tr>spines</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:128" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densae,</quote> <trans><tr>thorns</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxeae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>rocky peaks</tr>, <tr>crags</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 195, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46370.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of pike</hi> (a fish); perh. Esox sphyraena, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 54, § 154</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sudo: <entryFree id="n46371" type="main" key="su_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n46371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [Gr. root <foreign lang="greek">i)d-; i)=dos, i(dro/s,</foreign> sweat; Germ. Schweisz]. </sense><sense id="n46371.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> (class.), <hi rend="ital">to sweat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perspire.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46371.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46371.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sudat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine causā sudare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudavit et alsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 413</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenum sudantibus lacertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 707</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid cum Cumis Apollo sudavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 43, 98</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum sudasse simulacra nuntiatum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 27, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibere et sudare vita cardiaci est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 15:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in montes sudantes conscendimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 116</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46371.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to sweat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">perspire with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be wet with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moist with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drenched in</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">fit ut in speluncis saxa superne Sudent umore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:943" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 943</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cavae tepido sudant umore lacunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudabant fauces sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scuta duo sanguine sudasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor signa sanguine multo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma sudore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:455" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 455</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umore Cumanus Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:8:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: terra sudat sanguine, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 504, 33</bibl> (Trag. v. 213 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 582</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46371.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., of the moisture itself, <hi rend="ital">to sweat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distil</hi> from any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tibi odorato referam sudantia ligno Balsama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcis odoratis umor sudavit ab uvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:191" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 191</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46371.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, qs. to sweat or perspire from exertion, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to toil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">labor</hi> <cb n="SUDO" /> <hi rend="ital">hard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exert</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fatigue one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tire one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self out</hi>, etc. (rare but class.; cf. Ritschl in Rhein. Mus. Neue Folge, 12, p. 458 sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: contendo, luctor): sudabis satis, Si cum illo inceptas homine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in cassum defessi sanguine sudent, Augustum per iter luctantes ambitionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vides sudare me jamdudum laborantem, quomodo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudandum est his pro communibus commodis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:66:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 66, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mancipii redhibitione sudare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 14</bibl></cit> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">has meus ad metas equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 70: <cit><quote lang="la">sub ingenti pharetrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:443" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 443</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ferrea sudant Claustra remoliri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:526" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 526</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parabile est, quod natura desiderat: ad supervacua sudatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 4:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46371.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n46371.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To throw off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">emit by sweating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sweat out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exude</hi> (cf. destillo). </sense><sense id="n46371.9" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">et durae quercus sudabunt roscida mella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguia electra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balsamum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemora Orientis, ubi tura et balsama sudantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudata ligno Tura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 308</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum baca Venafri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:101:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 101, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 93:19" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 93, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 24, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46371.10" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (acc. to I. B.), <hi rend="ital">to sweat out</hi> a thing, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">carry on laboriously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo labore Cyclopum Sudatum thoraca capit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:436" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fibulam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vomere messes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">zonam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epigr. 23, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deunces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:149" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:92" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:189" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 189</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n46371.11" n="B" level="2"> Pregn. </sense><sense id="n46371.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To saturate with sweat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sweat through</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vestes sudatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46371.13" n="2" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to sweat through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pass</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spend in sweating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actae sub pellibus hiemes aestatesque inter bella sudatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:Pan. Theod. 8" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> Pan. Theod. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sudor: <entryFree id="n46372" type="main" key="su_dor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> [sudo). <sense id="n46372.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">sweat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perspiration</hi>: manat ex omni corpore sudor, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 399 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:944" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 944</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudor e corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:27:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 27, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: totum sudor habet corpus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 3</bibl> (Ann. v. 436 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">sudorem multum consecutum esse audiebamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculis simulacrum multo sudore manavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 34, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudor fluit undique rivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salsusque per artus Sudor iit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidus toto manabat corpore sudor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos Fumantis sudore quatit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sudor ad imos Manaret talos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occupat obsessos sudor mihi frigidus artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 632</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudore fluentia multo Bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 923" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 923</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 487" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Troad. 487</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibusdam in conspectu populi sudor erumpit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:122:6" default="NO">122, 6</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">obj.</hi> of verbs: <cit><quote lang="la">sudorem emittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 18, 18, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudores evocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 9, 48, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ciere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 46, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 6, 20, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 11, 60, § 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">elicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excutere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 217" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">detergere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 24 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 17, 57, § 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudorem coërcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 25, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudores sedare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 15, 52, § 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 19, 79, § 260</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudoribus corpus exinanire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudores exsistere toto corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <trans><tr>honey-dew</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 12, 12, § 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46372.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of any <hi rend="ital">liquid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">moisture</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. umor): maris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">smyrnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 504</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veneni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">picis (with liquor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 11, 21, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 15, 52, § 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum quod exit a fornace sudorem vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 69</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:19:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 19, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n46372.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (cf. sudo, I. B.), <hi rend="ital">sweat</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">toil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe labor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weariness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fatigue</hi> (class.; syn.: labor, contentio): Salmacida spolia sine sudore et sanguine, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl> (Trag. v. 36 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">victor exercitus, qui suo sudore ac sanguine inde (a Capuā) Samnites depulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multo ejus sudore ac labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 5, 12</bibl></cit> (1, 2); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stilus ille tuus multi sudoris est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:60:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 60, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudor circa testimonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:6" default="NO">6, 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summo cum sudore consequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:128:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 128, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">phalerae multo sudore receptae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 458</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creditur Sudoris minimum habere comoedia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 169</bibl></cit>: non est viri timere sudorem,<cb n="SUES" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 31:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 31, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudore acquirere quod possis sanguine parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 14</bibl></cit>: et bellicos sudores nostros barbaricae gentes cognoscunt, Just. Inst. prooem. § 1.</sense></entryFree>
sudorifer: <entryFree id="n46373" type="main" key="su_do_ri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdōrĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype> <etym>sudor-fero</etym>, <sense id="n46373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sudorific</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vapores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:21:206" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 21, 206</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sudorus: <entryFree id="n46374" type="hapax" key="su_do_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sudor</etym>, <sense id="n46374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dripping with sweat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sweaty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 354, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suduculum: <entryFree id="n46375" type="hapax" key="su_du^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdŭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sudes</etym>, <sense id="n46375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of whip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scourge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit> Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (cf. sudiculum).</sense></entryFree>
sudus: <entryFree id="n46376" type="main" key="su_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>se-udus; cf.: sudum siccum quasi seudum id est sine udo, Fest. pp. 294 and 295 Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n46376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without moisture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dry;</hi> and of the weather, <hi rend="ital">cloudless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear</hi> (class.; cf. serenus). </sense><sense id="n46376.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: ventorum flamina suda, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 31, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamen venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 234:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 234, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ver,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempestas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 42, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">splendor luminis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 11, p. 260, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta specula vel uda vel suda videre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 283, 37</bibl></cit>.—Adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">sudum,</quote> <trans><tr>brightly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46376.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sūdum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clear weather</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sudum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horologium mittam et libros, si erit sudum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum sudum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma Per sudum rutilare vident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 529</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:115" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 115</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46376.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Somewhat moist</hi> = subudus; <cit><quote lang="la">ardentia viscera adhuc suda de sanguine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sue: <entryFree id="n46377" type="main" key="Sue_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n46377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Assyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suebi: <entryFree id="n46378" type="main" key="Sue_bi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suēbi</orth>, v. Suevi.</entryFree>
suebri: <entryFree id="n46379" type="main" key="Suebri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suebri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Gaul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suel: <entryFree id="n46380" type="main" key="Suel"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suël</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n46380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Spain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suelleni: <entryFree id="n46381" type="main" key="Suelle_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suellēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Arabia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 157</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suelteri: <entryFree id="n46382" type="main" key="Suelteri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suelteri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sueo: <entryFree id="n46383" type="main" key="su^e^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype> <etym>assumed as a stem for the form sŭēmus, which is probably a contracted <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, = suevimus from suesco; cf. consuesco and the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ei)w/qamen</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n46383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be wont</hi>, <hi rend="ital">used</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">accustomed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">appellare suemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cernere suemus (dissyl.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perhibere suemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 369</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suesco: <entryFree id="n46384" type="main" key="su^esco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭesco</orth>, <itype>sŭēvi, sŭētum</itype> (dissyl. suēvi, suētum; sync. forms, suesti, suerunt, suesse, etc.; <sense id="n46384.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>, and cf. also the preced. art.), 3, <hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [Sanscr. svadhā, will, might, custom; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)/qos, h)=qos</foreign>]. </sense><sense id="n46384.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become used</hi> or <hi rend="ital">accustomed;</hi> in the <hi rend="ital">tempp. perff.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to have accustomed one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">to be wont</hi>, <hi rend="ital">used</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">accustomed</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n46384.2" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Tempp. press.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Drusus in Illyricum missus est, ut suesceret militiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 16, 91</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46384.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Tempp. perff.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">has Graeci stellas Hyadas vocitare suërunt, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 43, 111: a te id, quod suesti, peto, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittere suevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:793" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 793</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de divis dare dicta suërit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmis florere arbusta suësse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:912" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 912</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincere suevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 10, 17: <cit><quote lang="la">sueverat claustra remoliri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 194</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46384.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to accustom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habituate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">train</hi> (very rare in finite verb): <cit><quote lang="la">ut lectos viros ... disciplinae et imperiis suesceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 52</bibl></cit>. —Esp., <hi rend="ital">P.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">suētus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. </sense><sense id="n46384.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Accustomed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wont</hi>, <hi rend="ital">used</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habituated;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex aliis sentire sueti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:903" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 903</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala secundis rebus oriri sueta, Sall. Fragm. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 2, 18: suetus abstinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curru succedere sueti Quadrupedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 541</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vexare suëtae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitialem propter morbum despui suetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 34, § 69</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his (armis) ego suetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque conjugiis suscipiendis neque alendis liberis sueti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suetae aquis volucres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sueti latrociniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suetus civilibus armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 325</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46384.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">customary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usual</hi> (mostly post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">contra Cheruscis sueta aput paludes proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sueto militum contubernio gaudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 80 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">vestigium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 198, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibaria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, p. 232, 13.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">suē-tum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a custom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad sectae sueta conferunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 153, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suessa: <entryFree id="n46385" type="main" key="Suessa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suessa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*su/essa.</foreign> <sense id="n46385.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">five miles south of the Liris and eight from the sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founded</hi> B. C. 337 <hi rend="ital">by the</hi> <pb n="1791" /> <cb n="SUFF" /> <hi rend="ital">Aurunci</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and afterwards made their capital. It was often called Suessa Aurunca</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sessa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:15" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 8, 18</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">it was the birthplace of the satiric poet Lucilius</hi>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:20" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 15, 9</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n46385.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A very ancient city of Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colony of Alba</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conquered by Tarquinius Superbus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usually called Suessa Pometia. It was destroyed by Spurius Cassius</hi>, B. C. 502, <hi rend="ital">and its site is unknown</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 16</bibl> sq.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:775" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 775</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:24:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 24, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:400" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 400</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 15, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:69" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 16, 15, § 69</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Suessānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Suessa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Suessan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Suessano,</quote> <trans><tr>in the Suessan territories</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 22, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Suessā-ni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Suessa</hi> (Aurunca), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 151, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">262, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suessetani: <entryFree id="n46386" type="main" key="Suesseta_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suessetāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:20" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:42" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 42</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Suessetānus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suessiones: <entryFree id="n46387" type="main" key="Su^essi^o_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭessĭōnes</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭessōnes</orth>, trisyl., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 423</bibl>), <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Gaul</hi>, in the neighborhood of the modern <hi rend="ital">Soissons</hi>, Caes, B. G. 2, 3; 2, 12; 2, 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:6" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 17, 31, § 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suessula: <entryFree id="n46388" type="main" key="Suessu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suessŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n46388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Campania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Castel di Sessola</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 14</bibl>; 23, 17; 23, 32; 24, 46.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sues-sŭlāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Suessula</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 130</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2369</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suetonius: <entryFree id="n46389" type="main" key="Sue_to_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suētōnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. So, </sense><sense id="n46389.1" n="I" level="1"> C. Suetonius Paulinus (Lenis), <hi rend="ital">father of the foll.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46389.2" n="II" level="1"> C. Suetonius Tranquillus, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary and friend of the younger Pliny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author of the biographies of the first twelve Roman emperors</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:24:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 24, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 11, 3</bibl>. See, concerning him, Bähr's Röm. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Gesch. § 216 sq.</sense></entryFree>
suetri: <entryFree id="n46390" type="main" key="Suetri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suetri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Alpine people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suetudo: <entryFree id="n46391" type="main" key="sue_tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suētūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suesco</etym>, <sense id="n46391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">custom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">habit</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">blanda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Pell. Euchar. 179</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">271</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suetus: <entryFree id="n46392" type="main" key="sue_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of suesco.</entryFree>
suevi: <entryFree id="n46393" type="main" key="Sue_vi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suēvi</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Suēbi</orth> (in inscrr. always; but most MSS. have Suevi), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Suevi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a powerful people in the north-eastern part of Germany</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 51</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n46393.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Suēvus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Suē-bus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Suevi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Suevan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinis,</quote> <trans><tr>worn in the manner of the Suevi</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:134" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 134</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Suēvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Suevi</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Hon. 4, 655</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46393.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Suē-vĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Suēbĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Suevi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 43 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl> and 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n46393.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Suē-vĭcus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Suēbĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Suevic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 45 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
suevius: <entryFree id="n46394" type="main" key="Sue_vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suēvĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poet</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sufes: <entryFree id="n46395" type="foreign" key="su_fes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūfes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">suffes</orth>), <itype>ĕtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Phoen. <foreign />, a judge</etym>, <sense id="n46395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chief magistrate of the Carthaginians</hi>, corresponding to the Roman consul, <hi rend="ital">a sufet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:61" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 4:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3056 sq.</bibl> —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 61</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=309" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 309</bibl> Müll., and Gesen. Script. Phoenic. Monum. p. 394.</sense></entryFree>
sufetula: <entryFree id="n46396" type="main" key="Sufetu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sufetŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n46396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Africa</hi>, Aug. c. <bibl default="NO"><author>Donat.</author> 6, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suffarcino:
<entryFree id="n46397" type="main" key="suffarci^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-farcĭno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stuff full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cram</hi> (ante- and postclass.). </sense><sense id="n46397.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">incedunt suffarcinati cum libris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: vidi Cantharam Suffarcinatam, <hi rend="ital">stuffed out</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with a bundle under her dress</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellule suffarcinatus,</quote> <trans><tr>crammed full</tr>, <tr>gorged with food</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 246, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem multis muneribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, p. 230, 26.—</sense><sense id="n46397.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to deck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enrich</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auro et argento et veste,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Inst. Div. Litt. 28</bibl></cit>.</sense>
(* <orth extent="full" lang="la">suffarrānĕus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">suffarrānĭus</orth>, a false read. for furnariae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 43, 44, § 135</bibl> Sillig ad h. l.)</entryFree>
suffectio: <entryFree id="n46398" type="main" key="suffecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffectĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sufficio</etym> (post-class.). <sense id="n46398.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An adding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">macularum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 251</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46398.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A supplying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">substituting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animarum alterna mortuorum atque viventium suffectio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 28</bibl></cit>; cf. suffectura.</sense></entryFree>
suffectura: <entryFree id="n46399" type="main" key="suffectu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffectūra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a supplying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supplement</hi> (post-class.): suffectura <cb n="SUFF" /> est quodammodo spiritus animae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 28 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
suffectus: <entryFree id="n46400" type="main" key="suffectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of sufficio.</entryFree>
suffenates: <entryFree id="n46401" type="main" key="Suffe_na_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suffēnātes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Nebula Suffena</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a town in the Sabine territory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suffenus: <entryFree id="n46402" type="main" key="Suffe_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Suffēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n46402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bad poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ridiculed by Catullus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 14, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 1</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
sufferctus: <entryFree id="n46403" type="main" key="sufferctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sufferctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. suffertus.</entryFree>
sufferentia: <entryFree id="n46404" type="main" key="suffe^renti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffĕrentĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suffero</etym>, <sense id="n46404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enduring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toleration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sufferance</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jacob. 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ecclus. 16, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suffermentatus: <entryFree id="n46405" type="main" key="suffermenta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fermentātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [fermento], <sense id="n46405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat fermented</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suffero: <entryFree id="n46406" type="main" key="suffe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>sustŭli, sublātum, sufferre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n46406.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To carry under</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lay under</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. subicio): corium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: tergum, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 397, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46406.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n46406.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To offer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proffer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque mater potest sufferre lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 19</bibl></cit>.—T. t. in jurid. Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">litis aestimationem,</quote> <trans><tr>to tender</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:69" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 69 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:21" default="NO">21, 2, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46406.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hold up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustain</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. sustineo): an axis eum (mundum) sustineat an ipse se potius vi propriā sufferat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitiali morbo vexatus, ut stare, colligere semet ac sufferre vix posset,</quote> <trans><tr>hold himself upright</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46406.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to take upon one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undergo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffer</hi> an evil or grievance (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: patior, tolero): plagas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1304</bibl></cit>: poenas, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 396, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenam sui sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 13, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at Apollodorus poenas sustulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:33:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 33, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii poenas sufferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:21:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 21, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam multam si sufferre voluissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:33:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 33, 98</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro alicujus peccatis supplicium sufferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 17</bibl></cit>; in Plautus (like dare poenas alicui) with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde illi actutum sufferet suos servos poenas Sosia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vobis victi Poeni poenas sufferant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborem, solem, sitim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:8:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vites) valenter sufferunt ventos et imbres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi hoc pejus sit, haec sufferre et perpeti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> in Cic. Fam. 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec claustra nec ipsi Custodes sufferre valent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 492</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (iter) superest, sufferte pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 21, 21 et saep.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syre, vix suffero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>.—Ellipt.: <cit><quote lang="la">si magis me instabunt, ad praetorem sufferam (sc. me rapi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffertus: <entryFree id="n46407" type="main" key="suffertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffertus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">sufferctus</orth>, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:17:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 17, 3</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sub - farcio</etym>, <sense id="n46407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">crammed full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">subicit suffectus posteriorem, Lucil. l. l.: aliquid se sufferti tinniturum,</quote> <trans><tr>something full-sounding</tr>, <tr>sonorous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffervefacio: <entryFree id="n46408" type="main" key="sufferve_fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fervēfăcĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), no <sense id="n46408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to heat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">warm from below</hi> (Plinian), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 26, § 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">affirmant, lapillos, qui sufferveflant, rumpi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 9, 51, § 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aceti heminis quinque suffervefactis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 17, 21, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semuncia amyli cum ovo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 25, 67, § 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:142" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 10, 54, § 142</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suffervefio: <entryFree id="n46409" type="main" key="sufferve_fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffervēfīo</orth>, <itype>fĭĕri</itype>, v. suffervefacio.</entryFree>
sufferveo: <entryFree id="n46410" type="hapax" key="sufferve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fervĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to boil</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seethe gently</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suffes: <entryFree id="n46411" type="main" key="suffes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffes</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, v. sufes.</entryFree>
suffibulum: <entryFree id="n46412" type="main" key="suffi_bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffībŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sub-fibula</etym>, <sense id="n46412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a white four-cornered veil</hi>, worn on the head by priests and priestesses, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 21</bibl> Müll.; cf. Fest. pp. 348 and 349 ib.</sense></entryFree>
sufficiens: <entryFree id="n46413" type="main" key="suffi^ci^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffĭcĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of sufficio.</entryFree>
sufficienter: <entryFree id="n46414" type="main" key="suffi^ci^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffĭcĭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>sufficio</etym>, <sense id="n46414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sufficiently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enough</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,042:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Nah. 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 18</bibl> (29), 3 dub.</sense></entryFree>
sufficientia: <entryFree id="n46415" type="main" key="suffi^ci^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffĭcĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sufficiency</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 1, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 3, 5</bibl>; 9, 8.</sense></entryFree>
sufficio: <entryFree id="n46416" type="main" key="suffi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fĭcĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>fēci, fectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>facio</etym>. <sense id="n46416.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46416.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To put under</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46416.2" n="1" level="3"> Of a building, <hi rend="ital">to lay the foundation for</hi>: opus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 29</bibl> Zumpt. —</sense><sense id="n46416.3" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to put into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dip in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dye</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impregnate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imbue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tinge</hi>, lanam medicamentis, <hi rend="ital">to impregnate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imbue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tinge</hi>, Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 386, 10</bibl>, and 521, 19: <cit><quote lang="la">(angues) ardentes oculos suffecti sanguine et igni,</quote> <trans><tr>suffused</tr>, <tr>colored</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maculis suffecta genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:105" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffecta leto lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:822" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 822</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes sole suffecta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>shone through</tr>, <tr>irradiated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:5:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>.— <cb n="SUFF" /> </sense><sense id="n46416.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To give</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supply</hi> = suppeditare, <foreign lang="greek">u(pe/xein</foreign> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">(nebulae) sufficiunt nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cibus aliam naturam sufficit ex se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 704</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec aëra rarum Sufficiunt nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus Sufficit umorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 424</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut illae (salices) pecori frondem aut pastoribus umbras Sufficiunt saepemque satis et pabula melli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (Hispania) Italiae cunctarum rerum abundantiam sufficiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:1:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux agmina sufficit unus turbanti terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:36" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Horatius eos excursionibus sufficiendo adsuefacerat sibi fidere,</quote> <trans><tr>by permitting to take part in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:61:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 61, 12</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 27</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse pater Danais animos viresque secundas Sufficit,</quote> <trans><tr>gives courage and strength</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 618</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 803</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46416.5" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To occupy with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employ in</hi>: Horatius eos (milites) excursionibus (<case>dat.</case>) sufficiendo proeliisque levibus experiundo assuefecerat sibi fidere, <hi rend="ital">by employing them in sallies</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 61</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n46416.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To put in the place of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to substitute</hi> for another; and esp., <hi rend="ital">to choose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">elect in the place of</hi> any one (class.; esp. freq. of magistrates, e. g. of consuls; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. subrogo): suffectus in Lucretii locum M. Horatius Pulvillus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: in Appii locum suffectus, Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul in sufficiendo collegā occupatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:39:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 39, 85</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne consul sufficiatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 38, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censorem in demortui locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 31, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffectis in loca eorum novis regibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:10:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsae (apes) regem parvosque Quirites Sufficiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu tribunos modo seu tribunis suffectos consules quoque habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia collegam suffici censori religio erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 27, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:38:10" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 38, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus vitio creatis suffecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 7, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 47, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius patri suffectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Conon Alcibiadi suffectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:6:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperante heredem suffici se proximum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 10, 12</bibl></cit>.—Esp. in the phrase suffectus consul, <hi rend="ital">a consul elected after</hi> the regular time, <hi rend="ital">a vice-consul</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando duo ordinarii consules ejus anni alter morbo, alter ferro periisset, suffectum consulem negabant recte comitia habere posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:18:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 18, 16</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 43, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatus suffectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. 14, 2, § 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46416.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to take the place of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to supply instead of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to furnish as a substitute</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">atque aliam ex aliā generando suffice prolem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septimo eosdem (dentes) decidere anno, aliosque suffici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 15, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor caeli partes in ternas dividunt et singulis ventos binos suffectos dant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:16:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46416.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be sufficient</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to suffice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avail for</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meet the need of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satisfy</hi> (freq. and class.; syn. suppeto); constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne;</hi> rarely with <hi rend="ital">si.</hi> </sense><sense
