suffuscens: <entryFree id="n46473" type="spur" key="suffuscens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffuscens</orth>, false read. for suffundens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 39</bibl>.</entryFree>
suffusculus: <entryFree id="n46474" type="main" key="suffuscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffuscŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n46474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [suffuscus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat brown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brownish</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">homines Aegyptii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 16, 23</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 120, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suffuscus: <entryFree id="n46475" type="hapax" key="suffuscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suf-fuscus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">somewhat brown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brownish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dusky</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">margarita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
suffusio: <entryFree id="n46476" type="main" key="suffu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suff-ūsĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suffundo</etym>, <sense id="n46476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pouring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spreading into</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pouring over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a suffusion</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n46476.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <trans><tr>an infusion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cucumeris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46476.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., of diseases. </sense><sense id="n46476.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A spreading</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fellis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the jaundice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 23, 49, § 104</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46476.4" n="2" level="3"> Suffusio oculorum (oculi); and often <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> suffusio, <hi rend="ital">opacity of the cornea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cataract</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 6, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 1, 2, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:33" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 4, 14, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:114" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 11, 27, § 114</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n46476.5" n="3" level="3"> Suffusio pedis, <hi rend="ital">a disease of the feet of animals</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 38 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <trans><tr>inflammation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:23:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 23, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suffusorium: <entryFree id="n46477" type="hapax" key="suffu_so_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffūsōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel for pouring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pitcher</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 2, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Zach. 4, 12</bibl>; cf.: suffusorium <foreign lang="greek">e)pi/xusis,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
suffusus: <entryFree id="n46478" type="main" key="suffu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suffūsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subf-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from suffundo.</entryFree>
sugambri: <entryFree id="n46479" type="main" key="Su^gambri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sŭgambri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Sigambri.</entryFree>
sugdiani: <entryFree id="n46480" type="main" key="Sugdi^a_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sugdĭāni</orth>, v. Sogdiani.</entryFree>
suggero: <entryFree id="n46481" type="main" key="sugge^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sug-gĕro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subg-</orth>), <itype>gessi, gestum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n46481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to carry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lay under</hi>, etc. (class., esp. in the trop. sense). </sense><sense id="n46481.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammam costis aëni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 463</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem fornace succensā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 20, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46481.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To heap up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">raise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">build</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 8; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">celsis suggesta theatra columnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:644" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 644</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46481.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afford</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supply</hi> ( = praebeo, suppedito, ministro): <cit><quote lang="la">cur tu his rebus sumptum suggeris?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum apparatus, Auct. B. Alex. 3, 1: cibum animalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitias alimentaque (tellus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feras silvae affatim suggerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ructanti pinnas rubentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 8</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliae (apes) struunt, aliae suggerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 10, 10, § 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46481.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to afford</hi>, <hi rend="ital">furnish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supply</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiae flammam ac materiam criminibus suis suggerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suggeram quae vendatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam interrogationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 8</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46481.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sincipitamenta porcina, quae anteposita in mensā mihi bulimum suggerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 29</bibl></cit> Ritschl (MSS. milvina; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Brix ad loc.): aut Druso ludus est suggerendus aut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>is to be put upon</tr>, <tr>imposed upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 44, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46481.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To suggest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prompt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring to mind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoties aequitas restitutionem suggerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:6:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 6, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (res) suggerit, ut Italicarum rerum esse credantur eae res,</quote> <trans><tr>reminds</tr>, <tr>admonishes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:5:35" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 28, 5, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam de republicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 66:2" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 66, 2</bibl></cit>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">suggerente conjuge,</quote> <trans><tr>at the instigation of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 41:11" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 41, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suggerente irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:ib. 12:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46481.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To assign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">add</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subjoin</hi>: huic incredibili<pb n="1794" /> <cb n="SUGG" />  sententiae ratiunculas suggerit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 29, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiam argumentorum singulis generibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:27:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmamenta causae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 81, 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba, quae desunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26, 110</bibl></cit>: apud quosdam veteres auctores non invenio Lucretium consulem; <cit><quote lang="la">Bruto statim Horatium suggerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>place next in order</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:44" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quidam annales nihil praeter nomina consulum suggerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suggerebantur damna aleatoria,</quote> <trans><tr>were added</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suggestio: <entryFree id="n46482" type="main" key="suggesti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suggestĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subg-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>suggero</etym>. * <sense id="n46482.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an adding to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">addition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potus suggestione auctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:13:182" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 13, 182</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46482.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n46482.2" n="A" level="2"> A rhet. fig., where the orator puts a question and answers it himself, <hi rend="ital">a suggestion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod schema quidam per suggestionem vocant, i. e. per subjectionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46482.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A hint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intimation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suggestion</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 9:20" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 9, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suggestum: <entryFree id="n46483" type="main" key="suggestum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suggestum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n46483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a raised place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">height</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex suggesto faleris prodeunt anates in stagnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46483.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a platform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tribune</hi> for a speaker: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in communibus suggestis consistere non auderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud suggestum, in quo causam dixerat, ascendens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:54:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 54, 124</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suggestus: <entryFree id="n46484" type="main" key="suggestus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suggestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from suggero.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n46485" type="main" key="suggestus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suggestus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subg-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">suggestum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>suggero</etym>. <sense id="n46485.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to suggero, I.) An elevated place made of materials poured out; hence, <hi rend="ital">a raised place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a height</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elevation</hi> (cf. pulpitum). </sense><sense id="n46485.1" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46485.2" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">labrum in suggestu inter dolia positum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapideus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 10, 21, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suggestus in orchestrā,</quote> <trans><tr>a raised seat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:91" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 91</bibl> Duk.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:51:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 51, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a lofty head-dress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:113" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46485.3" n="b" level="4"> In partic., a raised place to speak from to the people, to the troops, etc., <hi rend="ital">a platform</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tribune</hi> (the class. signif. of the word): <cit><quote lang="la">suggestum in foro exstructum adornari placuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Maenius in suggestu rostra, devictis Antiatibus, fixerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 5, 11, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac re pro suggestu pronuntiatā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so in a milit. sense: de suggestu inquit, Auct. B. Afr. 54, 2: praemia pro suggestu tribuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 86, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suggestu, in quo Galbae statua fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non in modum contionis, aut suggestu locutus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 55</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the prætor's tribunal: in excelso suggestu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the emperor's seat: in curiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in orchestrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:51" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n46485.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">height</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neve se de tanto fortunarum suggestu pessum deiciat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 161, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46485.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A providing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preparation</hi> (post-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Circensium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n46485.6" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to suggero, II.) <hi rend="ital">A hint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">intimation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suggestion</hi> (syn. suggestio): <cit><quote lang="la">si ex suggestu eorum praeses dederit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:8:1:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 8, 1, § 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sugglutio: <entryFree id="n46486" type="hapax" key="sugglu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sug-glūtĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subg-</orth>), <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hiccup a little</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suggrandis: <entryFree id="n46487" type="hapax" key="suggrandis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sug-grandis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subg-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n46487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rather large</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suggredior: <entryFree id="n46488" type="main" key="suggre^di^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sug-grĕdĭor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subg-</orth>), <itype>gressus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n46488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [gradior], <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come up to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to approach</hi> (Tacitean). </sense><sense id="n46488.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesis qui barbarorum propius suggrediebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suggressi propius speculatores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">propius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 57</bibl></cit>; 14, 37.—</sense><sense id="n46488.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to attack</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos dux Romanus acie suggressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 4, 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suggrunda: <entryFree id="n46489" type="main" key="suggrunda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sug-grunda</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subg-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. grando; Sanscr. hrāduni, storm; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">xa/laza,</foreign> hail</etym>, <sense id="n46489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the lower border of a roof</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the eaves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:3:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:3:5:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 3, 5, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:242:section=1" default="NO">50, 16, 242, § 1</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">sug-grundium</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 102, § 160</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">suggrundātio</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
suggrundarium: <entryFree id="n46490" type="hapax" key="suggrunda_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suggrundārĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subg-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>suggrunda</etym>, <sense id="n46490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the grave of a child less than forty days old</hi> (which was a niche in a wall, covered by a projecting roof or eaves; cf. columbarium, 2. d.): suggrundaria antiqui dicebant sepulcra infantium, qui necdum XL dies implessent, quia nec busta dici poterant, quia ossa quae comburerentur<cb n="SUI" />  non erant, nec tanta cadaveris immanitas, quā locus tumesceret. Unde Rutilius Geminus Astyanacte ait: <cit><quote lang="la">Melius suggrundarium misero quaereres quam sepulcrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Expos. Serm. Ant. p. 560</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
suggrundatio: <entryFree id="n46491" type="main" key="suggrunda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">suggrundātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subg-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">suggrundium</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. suggrunda.</entryFree>
suggrunnio: <entryFree id="n46492" type="hapax" key="suggrunni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sug-grunnĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">subgr-</orth>), <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n46492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to grunt a little</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 27, 345</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sugillatio: <entryFree id="n46493" type="main" key="su_gilla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūgillātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sugillo</etym>, <sense id="n46493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blackand-blue mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a livid spot</hi> (made by a blow, bruise, etc.; not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n46493.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sugillationem rapere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 24, § 74</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n46493.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an affronting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insulting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foeda majestatis ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 45, 46, § 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsius gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:9:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admonitionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:22:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 22, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sugillatiuncula: <entryFree id="n46494" type="hapax" key="su_gilla_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūgillātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sugillatio</etym>, <sense id="n46494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small livid spot</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 2, 9</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
sugillatus: <entryFree id="n46495" type="hapax" key="su_gilla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūgillātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sugillo</etym>, post-class. for sugillatio, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 34</bibl>.</entryFree>
sugillo: <entryFree id="n46496" type="main" key="su_gillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūgillo</orth> (suggillo, oited ap. Victorin. p. 2465 P.), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. akin with sugo</etym>, <sense id="n46496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to beat black-andblue</hi> (mostly post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n46496.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi ex ictu suffusi cruore et sugillati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 9, 45, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">athleta, qui numquam sugillatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 13:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 13, 2</bibl></cit>: oculos patri, perh. <hi rend="ital">to knock out</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 171, 13</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sūgillāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. loca), <hi rend="ital">black-and-blue spots</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bruises</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">allium sugillata aut liventia ad colorem reducit,</quote> <trans><tr>black-and-blue spots</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 23, § 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseus recens cum melle sugillata emendat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 9, 34, § 132</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46496.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n46496.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To flout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jeer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scoff at</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insult</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viros sugillatos, repulsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:35:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 35, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sulla repulsa praeturae sugillatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:5:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudelitatem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3:4" default="NO">5, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli sugillare miserias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:10:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 4, 10, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinionem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:4:4:section=16" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 44, 4, 4, § 16</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">to annoy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 18, 5</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n46496.4" n="B" level="2"> = to beat into one, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to suggest</hi>: verba alicui, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 999.</sense></entryFree>
sugo: <entryFree id="n46497" type="main" key="su_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sūgo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root svag-; cf. sucus</etym>, <sense id="n46497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to suck</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n46497.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(animalium) alia sugunt, alia carpunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(agni) matris sugunt mammam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porca frequentiore numero sucta deficiet,</quote> <trans><tr>exhausted</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 26, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <trans><tr>to exhaust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:44:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 44, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n46497.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum lacte nutricis errorem suxisse,</quote> <trans><tr>to have sucked</tr>, <tr>imbibed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sui: <entryFree id="n46498" type="main" key="su^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sŭi</orth> (<sense id="n46498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>), <case>dat.</case> sĭbī^, <case>acc.</case> and <case>abl.</case> sē or sēsē, <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number> (old <case>dat.</case> sĭbei, C. I. L. 1, 38; 1, 1056; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 1180 et saep.: sibe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 1267</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 300</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 24</bibl>; and v. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 180 sq.; on the quantity of the final i, v. Ritschl, Opusc. 2, p. 632 sqq.; old <case>acc.</case> sed, C. I. L. 1, 196, 13 sq.; 1, 197, 21; strengthened <case>acc.</case> sepse = se ipse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:8:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 8, 12</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:32" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:44:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 44, 8 al.</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi> of 3d <hi rend="ital">pers.</hi> in recipr. and reflex. sense [Sanscr. sva-, svajam-, self; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e(, ve, sfe</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">ou(=, oi(=, e(/</foreign>); cf. suus, old Lat. sovos; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 396" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 396</bibl>; Corss. Ausspr. 2, p. 54], <hi rend="ital">of himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of herself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of themselves; one another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">each other</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">him</hi>, <hi rend="ital">her</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">them;</hi> and, as <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> of <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he</hi>, <hi rend="ital">she</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">they</hi> (on the use of se or sese in <case>acc.</case>, cf.: ut se dicamus, cum aliquem quid in alium fecisse ostendimus, ut puta: ille dicit se hoc illi fecisse; <cit><quote lang="la">cum autem in se ipsum, tunc dicamus sese, velut: dixit sese hoc sibi fecisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 1, 15, p. 86</bibl></cit> P.; but the distinction is not commonly observed; the two forms being used indifferently, except that sese is preferred where there is emphasis, especially at the beginning or end of a clause, or in reference to a preceding ipse; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>; and cf. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 182 sqq.). </sense><sense id="n46498.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., as <hi rend="ital">pron. reflex.</hi>, of an object considered as receiving or affected by its own act, <hi rend="ital">himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">herself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">themselves.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46498.2" n="A" level="2"> In all clauses, referring to the grammatical subject of the clause. </sense><sense id="n46498.3" n="1" level="3"> As direct <hi rend="ital">obj.</hi> of <hi rend="ital">verb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dedistine gladium, quī se occideret?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artis eloquar quem ad modum se expediant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in plagas conicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam erit alienis gravis qui suis se concinnat levem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: se aperiunt,<cb n="SUI" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adplicat ad Chrysidis patrem se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si is posset ab eā sese avellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi se ad nos adplicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per eos, ne causam diceret, se eripuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ferrum se inflexisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipites fugae sese mandabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si se telo defenderet fur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catoni licuit Tusculi se in otio delectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum igitur quod se ipsum movet, numquam ne moveri quidem desinit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 25, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statim homo se erexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majores acceperamus se a Gallis auro redemisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:59:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 59, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in montem sese recipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad inpedimenta se conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese alicui ad pedes proicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se gerere,</quote> <trans><tr>to behave</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:19:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 19, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic se res habet, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 271</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 10, 27</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod uxor sua ex fico se suspendisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:88" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 88</bibl></cit>. — Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">ipse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nom.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic se ipsus fallit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut se ipse diliget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:11:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse enim se quisque diligit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita non modo superiores, sed etiam se ipse correxerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:52:176" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 52, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne animal se ipsum diligit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:9:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque prius vim adhibendam putaverunt, quam se ipse indicasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles se ipse interfecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne, ignorando regem, semet ipse aperiret quis esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sese ipsi gravant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 10</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inperator qui se ipsum non continet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est enim se ipsum colligere, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:36:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 36, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 23, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quidam imperatores se ipsos dis inmortalibus devoverent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si se ipsos illi nostri liberatores e conspectu nostro abstulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:44:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 44, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admovisse semet ipsos lateri suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladio se ipsam transfixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:26:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 26, 3</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">gerund.</hi> construction: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sui in perpetuum liberandi occasionem dimittant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">principes sui conservandi causā profugerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximam causam ad se inundandam terra praestabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:29:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 29, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46498.4" n="2" level="3"> As indirect <hi rend="ital">obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo servit, non sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapiens ipsus fingit fortunam sibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ibi diffregisset crura aut cervices sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil aliud nisi quod sibi soli placet consulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerunt sibi liberos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum habeat sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum multae sibi expetessunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum me convivam solum abducebat sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sibi soli postulat, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc sibi uxorem expetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is sibi legationem ad civitates suscepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque sibi homines feros temperaturos existimabat, quin exirent, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc sibi nomen adrogare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:33:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 33, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia sunt tamquam sibi nata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proposita sibi morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 21, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne, illo cunctante, Numidae sibi consulant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 62:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 62, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut populum Romanum sibi desumerent hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Turnus, praelatum sibi advenam aegre patiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petebant ut regis sui filiam matrimonio sibi jungeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo sibi tantummodo errat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum sibi ad formam sui exsculpsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ipse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse tantos sibi spiritus sumpserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ipsi sibi exemplo sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste, quasi praedā sibi advectā, ducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:25:section=64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 25, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Junius necem sibi ipse conscivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntarium non sibimet ipse solum, sed etiam funeri suo exilium indixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:52:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 52, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde consulant sibi ipsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:4:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritia, quae quicquid omnibus abstulit, sibi ipsi neget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1, prol. 6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, prol. 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Marc. 5, 13</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n46498.5" n="3" level="3"> After <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnino est amans sui virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut sit sui similis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem naturam esse servatricem sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:9:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum videret, si non paruisset, dissimilem se futurum sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 19, 43</bibl>: nihil malo quam et me mei similem esse et illos sui, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 16</bibl>, A, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">habetis ducem memorem vestri, oblitum sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potens sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est tam incontinens sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:30:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 30, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sibi obsit, quia sit sibi inimicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:10:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 10, 28</bibl></cit>: inimicus ipse <pb n="1795" /> <cb n="SUI" /> sibi putandus est, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ipsi homines sibi sint per se cari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Medus infestus sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crescit indulgens sibi hydrops,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec enim utilius quicquam est quam sibi utilem fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:11:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Campanus se digna probra in insontem jacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mundus) se ipse consumptione alebat sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum multa adsoleat veritas praebere vestigia sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:54:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 54, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecus amor sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui contemptor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in spem sui bonam adducitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:21:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aër) imā sui parte maxime varius est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:11:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa (virtus) pretium sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 9:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque est quod existimes illum vilem sibi fuisse: pretium se sui fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:9:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 1, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe taedio laboris ad vilitatem sui compelluntur ignavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:9:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo non benignus est sui judex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:26:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanus in ipso fine vitae vindex sui exstitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equestris ordinis juventus omnibus annis bis urbem spectaculo sui celebrabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:2:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. with <hi rend="ital">ipse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utpote ipsā sui appellatione virorum majestati debitum a feminis reddens honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n46498.6" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">prepp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui admisit in se culpam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam ut ab se segregent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segregat ab se omnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ad se deduxit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 121</bibl></cit>; 3, 1, 118; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae me non excludit ab se, sed apud se occludet domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet aliud (negotium) magis ex se et majus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et fingunt quandam inter se nunc fallaciam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duxit secum virginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:18" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex se generare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: — pro se quisque = unusquisque, <hi rend="ital">every one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">each one singly</hi>, etc., freq. in Livy (cf. suus, II. D. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">Pro se quisque id quod quisque potest ... Edit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro se quisque alius agnum inmolabat, alius pullum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:6:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro se quisque sedulo Faciebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pro se quisque tenderet ad portas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 9</bibl>; 1, 59; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 6: — Boiosque receptos ad se socios sibi adsciscunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum ante se mittit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra se collocare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex materiā in se omnia recipiente mundum factum esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 37, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras ad se ab amico missas protulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam prae se agentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:21" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (rem publicam) exercitus, quantum in se fuit, prodebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphic. 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iphic. 3, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 12, 2</bibl> (v. infra, II. B. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus poterat sauciis ductis secum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 39</bibl></cit>.—Rarely referring to <hi rend="ital">subj. inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam dicere apud eum de facinore ... cum per se ipsum consideres, grave est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quia per se beatum est malo caruisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1, prol. 6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, prol. 6</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46498.7" n="5" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> in <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis se aut suorum aliquem praetermissum queratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (nominibus) illae res publicae sese appellari velint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 33, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui se minus timidos existimari volebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46498.8" n="6" level="3"> As predicate ( = suus, II. B. 2. <foreign lang="greek">d;</foreign> very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quisquis est deus, si modo est alius ... totus est sensuus, totus visuus, totus audituus, totus animae, totus animi, totus sui,</quote> <trans><tr>in his own power</tr>, <tr>independent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 14</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46498.9" n="B" level="2"> Referring to a <hi rend="ital">logical subject</hi>, other than the grammatical subj. of the clause. </sense><sense id="n46498.10" n="1" level="3"> To a <hi rend="ital">definite subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque praeter se umquam ei servos fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc aiebant indignum civitate ac sese vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 176</bibl></cit>: exercitum consumptum videtis; <cit><quote lang="la">quem turpiter se ex fugā recipientem ne qua civitas recipiat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquos sese convertere cogunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis illi in urbibus reficiendi se et curandi potestas fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur his persequendi juris sui adimis potestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum nihil sit periculosius quam spatium confirmandi sese Antonio dari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantam ingenuit animantibus conservandi sui natura custodiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque sui colligendi hostibus facultatem relinquunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quam minimum spatii ad se colligendos Romanis daretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19</bibl></cit>; 3, 4; 4, 34; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:16" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallica acies nullum spatium respirandi recipiendique se dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 28, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec raptis aut spes de se melior aut indignatio est minor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: Faustulo spes fuerat regiam stirpem<cb n="SUI" />  apud se educari, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium cum fiduciā sui commissum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 33, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 14, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">detecta fraus cautiores Thyreensis fecit: dato responso, nullam se novam societatem accepturos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres censuerunt, qui honorem, quem sibi capere per leges liceret, peteret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jusso magistro equitum abdicare se magistratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:33:12" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 33, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cum apud timentes sibimet ipsos increpuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 37, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ipso, quaerenti sibi commendationem ad gentem monitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 8, 4</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">signa peditum, prae se habentium scuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invenere oppidanos vim hostium ab se arcentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exire enim sua secum efferentibus jussis primum arma ademit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 18, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">§ 10: quos in numerum pecorum redegit ignoratio sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 5:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia nullum illis sui regimen est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 94, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se nihil inlicitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi objurgatio sui est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46498.11" n="2" level="3"> To <hi rend="ital">indefinite subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deforme est de se ipsum praedicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:38:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 38, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posse enim liberalitate uti non spoliantem se patrimonio nimirum est pecuniae fructus maximus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non arbitrari sese scire quod nesciat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui proposita sit conservatio sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:13:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic amicitiae ... effectrices sunt voluptatum tam amicis quam sibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amare ... etiam si ad se ex iis nihil redeat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 24, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(judicatio) quae aut sui laudem aut adversarii vituperationem contineat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:51:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 51, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:36:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 36, 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:139" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 39, 139</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, quanti quisque se faciat, tanti fiat ab amicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 28, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:17:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 17, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nullus ex se metus aut spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterum et interrogandi se ipsum et respondendi sibi solent esse non ingratae vices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi servire gravissima est servitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3</bibl></cit>, praef. 17: <cit><quote lang="la">quam multa sunt vota, quae etiam sibi fateri pudet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:38:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 6, 38, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec haec vilitas sui est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Clem. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpa est, immiscere se rei ad se non pertinenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:17:36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 17, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profecto est supplicio se liberare tam facile quam supplicium perpeti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n46498.12" n="II" level="1"> Hence, in dependent clauses, transf., as <hi rend="ital">pers. pron.</hi> 3d <hi rend="ital">pers.</hi>, with reflex. reference, <hi rend="ital">him</hi>, <hi rend="ital">her</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">them; he</hi>, <hi rend="ital">she</hi>, <hi rend="ital">they</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n46498.13" n="A" level="2"> In gen., of an obj. indentified with, </sense><sense id="n46498.14" n="1" level="3"> The <hi rend="ital">gram. subj.</hi> of the principal clause: <cit><quote lang="la">qui omnis se amare credit, quemque aspexerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa mulier lapidem silicem subigere ut se amet, potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. prol. 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orare jussit, si se ames, jam ut ad sese venias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ait, si ... non id metuat, ne, ubi acceperim, Sese relinquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timet animum amicae se erga ut sit suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumque jussit interfici, alterum, quia viam demonstravisset interimendi sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui precabantur, ut sibi sui liberi superstites essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:28:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 28, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:17:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 17, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ipse quidem suā tantā eloquentiā mihi persuasisset, ut se dimitterem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 28, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetrat a senatu, ut dies sibi prorogaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:38:section=98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 38, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc sibi ex animo scrupulum, qui se dies noctisque stimulat, ut evellatis, postulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iccius nuntios ad eum mittit, nisi subsidium sibi submittatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos cum apud se conspexisset ... quid ad se venirent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittit, qui petant atque orent, ut sibi subveniat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipionem Hannibal eo ipso, quod adversus se dux lectus esset, praestantem virum credebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 39, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pausanias orare coepit, ne se prodiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ejus principes animadvertisset timere, ne propter se bellum eis Lacedaemonii indicerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Them. 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ubii legatos mittunt, qui doceant ... neque ab se fidem laesam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum Volero, ubi indignantium pro se acerrimus erat clamor, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:55:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 55, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transfugit, patris in se saevitiam conquerens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 53, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia imposuit in urbibus, quae ad se defecerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 61:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 61, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigia sarcina depressa parum ostendunt non aquam sibi resistere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:9:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.—So in phrases incorporated with a principal clause: <cit><quote lang="la">Nicias vehementer tuā sui memoriā delectatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est appetentius similium sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 14, 50</bibl></cit>: Pompeius facultatem sui insequendi ademerat, Caes. B. <cb n="SUI" /> C. 1, 29: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectum in se ruentem trans fixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rediere cum legatis ad redimendos sese missis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:59:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 59, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potestatem omnibus adeundi sui fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germanicus legiones universas sibi summam reipublicae deferentes compescuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam si di inmortales potestatem visendi sui faciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:19:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 19, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(terra) non potest tam multa tantoque se ipsā majora nutrire, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:16:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 6, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46498.15" n="2" level="3"> Of an obj. indentified with a logical subj., other than the gram. subj. of the leading clause: <cit><quote lang="la">a Caesare valde liberaliter invitor, sibi ut sim legatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum unum quidque ... a se potius quam ab adversariis stare demonstrabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:43:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 43, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:16:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 16, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam mihi scito jam a regibus adlatas esse litteras, quibus mihi gratias agant, quod se meā sententiā reges appellaverim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testem rei publicae relinquere, meae perpetuae erga se voluntatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos non tam ulcisci studeo quam sanare sibi ipsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo ex oppido cum legati ad eum venissent oratum, ut sibi ignosceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ei in suspitionem venisset, aliquid in epistulā de se esse scriptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortem octavam decimam Lugduni, solitis sibi hibernis, relinqui placuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 64</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46498.16" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in reported words or thoughts (orat. obliqua) referring to the person to whom they are ascribed. </sense><sense id="n46498.17" n="1" level="3"> As <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">obj.</hi>, direct or indirect, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos Hannibal misit astrictos jure jurando se redituros esse, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:13:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 13, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Postumius mihi nuntiavit ... se a Marcello ad me missum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui dixisse fertur a se visum esse Romulum ... eum sibi mandasse ut populum rogaret ut sibi eo in colle delubrum fieret: se deum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 10, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 35, 95</bibl> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntium mittit ... sese diutius sustinere non posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Divitiacus Caesarem obsecrare coepit ... scire se illa esse vera, nec quemquam ex eo plus quam se doloris capere ... sese tamen amore fraterno commoveri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum se esse, qui, etc. ... ob eam rem se ex civitate profugisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec sibi esse curae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sese Gallis, sed Gallos sibi bellum intulisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsos se inter multitudinem militum occultasse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensit Themistocles, si eo pervenisset, sibi esse pereundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dato responso (sc. a Thyreensibus), nullam se novam societatem accepturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 12, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46498.18" n="2" level="3"> In subordinate clauses, questions, exhortations, etc., with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n46498.19" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui abs te taciti requirunt, cur sibi hoc oneris imposueris, cur se potissimum delegeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:18:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 18, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Marc. 10, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conclamavit, quid ad se venirent?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
