G. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum petere ac deprecari ... ne se armis despoliaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quos cum Caesar nuntios misisset, qui postularent, eos qui sibi bellum intulissent, sibi dederent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur sui quicquam esse imperii trans Rhenum postularet?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cicero respondit, si ab armis discedere velint, se adjutore utantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veneti legationem ad Crassum mittunt, si velit suos recipere, obsides sibi remittat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex ignarus quae legati ejus (Hannibalis) ad se adlaturi fuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac necessitate coactus, domino navis, qui sit, aperit, multa pollicens, si se conservasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatos in Bithyniam miserunt, qui ab rege peterent, ne inimicissimum suum secum haberent sibique dederet (for secum, v. I. A. 4. supra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46498.20" n="b" level="4"> Esp., in subordinate clauses (sub-oblique), with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> expressing the assertion or view of the person reported as speaking: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam Caesarem injuriam facere, qui vectigalia sibi deteriora faceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sibi Caesar denuntiaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed eo deceptum, quod neque commissum a se intellegeret, quāre timeret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nec paratus ... obsecutus esset, credidissetque, cum se vidissent Aetoli, omnia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:44:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 44, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ambiorix locutus est, ... sua esse ejusmodi imperia, ut non minus haberet juris in se multitudo, quam ipse in multitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Divitiacus ait, ... nec quemquam ex eo plus quam se doloris capere, propterea quod per se crevisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: eos incusavit, quod sibi <pb n="1796" /> <cb n="SUI" /> quaerendum aut cogitandum putarent, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decima legio Caesari gratias egit, quod de se optimum judicium fecisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doluisse se, quod populi Romani beneficium sibi extorqueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum ei dormienti eundem visum esse rogare ut, quoniam sibi vivo non subvenisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:27:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 27, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipionem Hannibal eo ipso, quod adversus se dux potissimum lectus esset, praestantem virum credebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 39, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pausanias orare coepit ... quod si eam veniam sibi dedisset, magno ei praemio futurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque prius vim adhibendam putaverunt, quam se ipse indicasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar legatos cum his mandatis mittit, Quoniam ... hanc sibi populoque Romano gratiam referret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos esse iniquos, quod in suo jure se interpellaremus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ipsos in his contentionibus, quas Aedui secum habuissent, usos esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximae sibi laetitiae esse praedicavit, quod aliquos patria sua se meliores viros haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 4</bibl></cit>, ext. 5.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi> when the author asserts the action as a fact: Volero, ubi indignantium pro se acerrimus erat clamor, etc. ( = eo; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">infra, C.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:55:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 55, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46498.21" n="C" level="2"> Without reflex. reference, = an oblique case of is or ipse (in the best prose rare, and mostly where the conception of the orat. obliq. is suggested by the context; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">B. 2. b. supra): i, seis, jube transire huc quantum possit, se ut videant domi Familiares ( = eam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me misit miles ad Eam ... ut hinc in Elatiam hodie eat secum semul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eum, qui se hic vidit, verbis vincat, ne is se viderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. v. 35; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 2, 54: ut eam in se dignam condicicnem conlocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi hi mihi dant viam, quo pacto ab se argentum auferam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicit capram, quam dederam servandam sibi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum hoc scio, esse meritam, ut memor esses sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Epaminondas accusatur, quod ei, qui sibi ex lege praetor successerat, exercitum non tradiderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:33:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 33, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et se ipsum nobis, et eos, qui ante se fuerunt, in medio posuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit> (but B. and K. bracket se): <cit><quote lang="la">Dexo hic, quem videtis, non quae privatim sibi eripuisti, sed unicum abs te filium flagitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:49:section=128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 49, § 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea quam exposuit quae sibi videbantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:54:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 54, 122</bibl></cit> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">B. and K. ipsi): et cum ad illum scribas, nihil te recordari de se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:7:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 7, § 23</bibl></cit> (B. and K. bracket de se): <cit><quote lang="la">quem Caesar, ut erat de se meritus, donatum pronuntiavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar Rhenum transire constituit ... quod auxilia contra se Treveris miserant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 9 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Metellus ... in eis urbibus, quae ad se defecerant ... praesidia inponit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 61:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 61, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:66:1" default="NO" valid="yes">66, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bocchus flectitur, reputando quae sibi duobus proeliis venerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 103:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 103, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuit urbis, quae ... adversum se opportunissimae erant, circumvenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 88:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 88, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse ... ex perfugis cognitis ... qui cum eo (Scipione) bellum contra se gerebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 8" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel quia nil rectum, nisi quod placuit sibi, ducunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 8, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum boves militibus dono dedit, qui secum fuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 37, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalem angebat, quod Capua pertinacius oppugnata ab Romanis quam defensa ab se ... animos averterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 38, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter victus fratrum ante se strage,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 25, 11</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 6, 12: Caesar ... omnibus qui contra se arma tulerant, ignovit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:56:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 56, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam obsidione Massiliae, quae sibi in itinere portas clauserat, retardante ... tamen omnia subegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus rector circa se dimicans occubuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod eos coëgit superare Lacedaemonios, quos ante se nemo ausus fuit aspicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 8, 3</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ante illum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphic. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Iphic. 1, 3</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">quae nox sibi proxima venit, insomnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:805" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 805</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n46498.22" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pron. recipr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">each other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam cum esset Praenestinis nuntiatum ... patres ac plebem in semet ipsos versos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 28, 1</bibl></cit>; so very rare, except in phrase: inter se, <hi rend="ital">one another</hi>, <hi rend="ital">each other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mutually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reciprocally,</hi> = <foreign lang="greek">a)llh/lous</foreign> (prop. <hi rend="ital">between</hi> or <hi rend="ital">among them</hi>, <hi rend="ital">among themselves</hi>, hence no ellips. of another se is to be assumed; cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 609; Hand, Turs. 3, p. 397 sqq.): nil cessarunt ilico Osculari atque<cb n="SUI" />  amplexari inter se, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">video eos inter se amare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque solum colent inter se ac diligent (cf. ante: alter ab altero postulabit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:22:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 22, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cicerones pueri amant inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:44:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 44, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se adspicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se congruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">complecti inter se milites coepisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:42:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 42, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut neque inter se contingant trabes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se nondum satis noti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:39:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 39, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus et senatus Romanus placide modesteque inter se rempublicam tractabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum summā inter se contentione gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 16, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum inter se timerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eum. 4, 2</bibl>: haec inter se quam repugnent, <hi rend="ital">contradict</hi> one another, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:29:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 29, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:12:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 12, 30</bibl> (cf.: sibi repugnare, <hi rend="ital">to be inconsistent</hi> with itself; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 1018): inter se differre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur legendi sint, nisi ipsi inter se, qui idem sentiunt, non intellego,</quote> <trans><tr>by one another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quosdam inter se similis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res inter se similes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:17" default="NO">9, 4, 17</bibl>. — With <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhaesitationes atomorum inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res eos in bello inter se habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 79, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">auxerant inter se opinionem,</quote> <trans><tr>their mutual regard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:39:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 39, 9</bibl></cit>.—Pleon.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam inter se utriusque conferte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositis inter se rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 66:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 66, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitatur duriorum inter se congressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 35</bibl></cit>.—Of local relation: <cit><quote lang="la">duas insulas propinquas inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 61</bibl></cit> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 98:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 98, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam haud procul inter se erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 53:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 53, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud longe inter se castra facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 55:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 55, 6</bibl></cit> (inter se, without recipr. reference, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>, I. A. 4.).</sense><sense id="n46498.23" n="IV" level="1"> Idiomatic uses. </sense><sense id="n46498.24" n="A" level="2"> Se, with <hi rend="ital">prepp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">home;</hi> mostly ad se, apud se, <hi rend="ital">to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">at one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">home</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at home</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae me non excludet ab se, sed apud se occludet domi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam in aedis me ad se deduxit domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ad se ad prandium, ad cenam vocant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 118</bibl></cit>: intro nos vocat ad sese, tenet intus apud se, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 86</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Caesar, ut veniam ad se, rogat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui a me petierit ut secum et apud se essem cottidie,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n46498.25" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">num tibi videtur esse apud sese?</quote> <trans><tr>in his senses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 85</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46498.26" n="B" level="2"> Sibi pleonast. as <case>dat.</case> of the interested person: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse autem Ariovistus tantus sibi spiritus sumpserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum sibi M. Pisonis domum ubi habitaret elegerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. I. A. 2. supra. So esp. freq. in expressions of surprise or abrupt questions (commonly, but loosely called a <hi rend="ital">dat. ethic.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quid sibi vult pater? cur simulat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid sibi hic vestitus quaerit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes admiratio cepit, quidnam sibi repentinus clamor vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ergo sibi vult pars altera orationis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 12, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirantes, quid sibi vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 35, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:15" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 50, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 13, 12</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">32, 25, 10: pro deum fidem quid vobis vultis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:67:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 67, 7</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n46498.27" n="C" level="2"> Sibi with <hi rend="ital">suus</hi>, emphasizing the idea of possession, <hi rend="ital">his own</hi>, etc. (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cocleae ... Suo sibi suco vivont,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed is quo pacto serviat suo sibi patri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> prol. 5; <cit><quote lang="la">46: si ille huc salvos revenit, reddam suom sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 119</bibl></cit> Brix. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">suam sibi rem salvam sistam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus argumento'st suom sibi proscaenium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> prol. 57; <cit><quote lang="la">97: omnem rem inveni, ut sua sibi pecunia hodie illam faciat leno libertam suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo sibi gnato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc telo suo sibi a foribus pellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua sibi ingenua indoles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo sibi gladio hunc jugulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvas suo sibi pampino tegito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo sibi jure ablui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:R. R. 12:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 12, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:41" default="NO">12, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo sibi argumento refutatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:10:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suo sibi lacte aleret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a suis sibi parentibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 104, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suis sibi domibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1</bibl></cit>, p. 106, 31; 4, p. 157, 7; <cit><quote lang="la">6, p. 186, 24: qui Deo ... sua sibi opera praetulerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 28, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suo sibi pervoluta sanguine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 207, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sua sibi natione captivus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">IN SVO SIBI POSITVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">AEDEM CVM SVO SIBI HYPOGAEO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Rein.</author> p. 646, 109</bibl></cit>.—In many passages in class. prose sibi <cb n="SULC" /> occurs with suus, but retains its pronom. force: <cit><quote lang="la">factus consul est bis, primum ante tempus, iterum sibi suo tempore, rei publicae paene sero,</quote> <trans><tr>in good time for himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis superque esse sibi suarum cuique rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam tu suum sibi venderes, ipse possedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:37:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 37, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vult ille inbecillitatis sibi suae conscius timere pituitam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:2:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 2, 4</bibl></cit> (v. suus II. D. 3. <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
